Pops aren't going to rapidly abandon their beliefs even if they are changed by circumstances over time.

@Aquos

@Aquos

They have no money. Unlike say, the Industrialists who have a huge amount of wealth.

@deaththrower

@lawsome

With minimum wages some industries need to devote more profits to worker pay, meaning less money for the capitalists. But it's not a huge difference, most industries pay pretty well in Canada.

@AdamGenesis

@Daniel "neondt" Tolman Seeing how you said that quick and large economic booms can both a blessing and a curse, a curse because you'll eventually go down and suffer some turmoil. Does this mean it should incentivize players to grow their economies gradually? Not all at once.

That's the safe and cowardly way, sure. I prefer to ride the boom and use the money to invest in other industries so things don't fall apart when the boom ends.

As a smaller nation risks are often worth taking

Because the alternative is staying small and irrelevant

@Avian Overlord

I guess one downside of my AAR's is that you're only getting my playstyle, and my commentary on things that I personally find interesting

I can't really say whether the way I play will be representative of most players, because the game isn't out yet.

I'm on vacation and these AAR's have been because I'm having fun with the game. I've definitely experienced burnout with a game due to work, but thus far that hasn't happened for V3 (edited)

Daniel "neondt" Tolman

I'm on vacation and these AAR's have been because I'm having fun with the game. I've definitely experienced burnout with a game due to work, but thus far that hasn't happened for V3

I think it will be harder to find the time and energy to do this when I get back to work. And being in work mode will tempt me to fix bugs etc while I play instead of just enjoying the game. Work definitely has an impact, and I'm trying to have a healthy work-life balance by playing just for fun and not to generate bug reports or design feedback

@caesar15

So you’re saying everyone should go back to work except for you so we can potentially get more AAR’s

Daniel "neondt" Tolman

They should pay me to do nothing but play for fun and never report bugs

I should be a twitch streamer

I might actually start streaming post-release, if that's something people are interested in. Would mostly be challenge runs with lots of specific stipulations, like Prestigious Pope of Confederated Canada.

@Lion - (Political) Party Pooper

@Turd Ferguson

Release will be in the future, assuming no cancellation or civilization-ending apocalyptic events

Just had a really dumb idea for a stipulation run - "Populism". Playing as a democracy, always form governments with the most votes and only enact laws that have a Movement supporting them. (edited)

You'd end up with a nonsensical hodgepodge of laws and it would be very funny

It might be that a liberal government got the most votes, but a movement forms to enact serfdom so we roll with it

We pander to all political pressure

We have no ideals or values of our own

@Yagami913

Maybe USA?

France would actually work well, because it has some fairly conservative laws but some fairly progressive IG's

@Chadicus Maximus

I’m hoping someone can mod the warfare system to somewhat resemble traditional paradox games

This is definitely impossible

If you want to play EU4 or V2, play EU4 or V2

V3 isn't an iteration on V2, it's very much its own game and not a V2.5. I expect there will be some diehard V2 fans that won't really like V3 and that's fine. I expect we'll pick up a lot of new fans who like what V3 is though.

I would call V3 more of a reinvention of the Victoria series rather than an iteration on the previous title

The differences between V3 and V2 are drastically greater than e.g. the differences between EU3 and EU4

@aalgus

I've always been curious: are the code of new iterations of games based on the previous titles? (i.e. V3 based on V2 code, EU4 based on EU3).

They sometimes have been, sometimes not

V2 code isn't indecipherable magic, it's just janky and nightmarish to work with

@Skellius9(An-Staf-Wor-ism)

@General_WCJ

@Meriador_

I know I'm definitely not a rational actor, I assume people generally aren't

@Lloyien

@Daniel "neondt" Tolman Quick question for you. I'm not sure if you saw earlier, but would it be possible to mod in a pair of goods that were 100% substitutable between each other (e.g. Fruit and Refrigerated Fruit), the one being treated like a service good (meaning it isn't tradeable outside the region it's produced) and the other being tradeable on the market and with the rest of the world as a whole? Obviously, production methods would determine which good is being produced at that time.

Sounds do-able

I am not sure this is the best forum to discuss Hume's view of human nature

I have 2 philosophy degrees

AAR : Canada - Pt.3 - by Daniel "neondt" Tolman

I think it's Canada time again. CONFEDERATED CANADA continues here

@MasterPaw

What are you goals now?

Still need public healthcare, but I guess things have evolved a bit. New goal is social democratic utopia.

So I've run into a bit of a blocker in terms of reforms. I have this really powerful capitalist class who really really don't enjoy things like worker's rights and welfare. Their power bases are the industries that support our economy - coal, wood, motors, chemicals. These industries are the very same that the Trade Unions draw their own ranks from, so I can't just transition my economy to other industries to disempower the capitalists.

I need to figure out a way to continue passing reforms without the Industrialists overthrowing the government

@Prymalfire

It sounds like a meme, but seizing the means of production does look like an answer

That would definitely cause the revolution I'm trying to avoid, is the problem

One thing I can do is invest further in Internal Security through my Guaranteed Liberties law. This will make revolutions much less likely to succeed. But that just gives me a buffer, I'll still hit a wall eventually

@lawsome

Would stronger income taxation help curb their power?

I expect it would. Relieving the tax burden from the lower strata and adding it to the upper strata will definitely even out the balance of power..

Our current income tax law is Payroll Tax, which primary puts the tax burden on the lower and middle strata

I could actually move to Proportional Income Tax without radicalizing the Industrialists..

@Prymalfire

If you agitate the trade unions and accept their demands, do the industrialists get as mad as if you did it yourself?

They like me far too much for that to be an option

I think I'll let the Industrialists cool off from all those other laws I passed for a while, while I expand my institutions. Then I'll try for Proportional Income Tax. And while that's all going on, I think it's time for Women's Suffrage

This is the first time that one of my reforms has actually been opposed my Mackenzie's Intelligentsia. Liberals like progress, but not too much progress.

I think it may be time to form a government that does not include the Intelligentsia

The Mackenzie government is over. He had a great run. Under his watch Canada become a successful, industrialized, and progressive nation.

Now it's time for a new Governor. Gordon Maitland is leader of the Trade Unions, and he has strong Feminist beliefs. He firmly believes in he need for universal Women's Suffrage.

Since we're passing a law that the Intelligentsia don't like, and we've also kicked them out of the government, we're no longer getting their bonuses. Goodbye 100% migration attraction.

@veluum

No more burden on bureaucracy

We still need to expand our government administrations to prepare for more burdens on the bureaucracy however. We have a lot of institutions to expand!

I'll simultaneously expand Internal Security and Social Security. I'm doubling the minimum wage.

Building a lot of administration buildings to keep up with these institutions

Also, time to use dynamite in the Yukon iron mines

We also really need to expand our railway infrastructure

There must be a better way than expanding railways..

hmm

Guess we need more power plants

That's odd. The Landowners have clawed their way back to relevance. Only barely, but enough to ally with the PB to oppose Women's Suffrage

They're not going to be able to stop it though

AAR : Canada - Pt.4 - by Daniel "neondt" Tolman

It's time for the thrilling conclusion of CONFEDERATED CANADA

And it is the conclusion because I've already finished playing. I'll just be reporting on what happened up to the end.

Quite a lot has happened. I think when I last reported an update, Canada was in a bit of a rough patch, with business struggling to pay workers due to the high minimum wage

Through extensive economic micro I was able to mitigate this problem through the use of TECHNOLOGY

Inventions such as the Steam Donkey allowed me to activate production methods that automated my industry to a greater degree, generating more outputs. This requires more material inputs like coal and tools, but the reduction in less qualified labourers meant a huge reduction in wage expenses.

This did slightly empower the Industrialists and disempower the Trade Unions, but not as much as you'd think. Although we employed less lower strata pops overall, we employed more Machinists who are more likely to be politically engaged, and those machinists make excellent wages due to the their profitable places of employment. (edited)

@Skellius9(An-Staf-Wor-ism)

does this not lead to unemployment

Yes, but we have welfare so there's a floor to how poor pops can be

Shortly after dealing with the economic problem, the Feminist movement kicked off for real. The previous attempt at enacting Women's Suffrage rested on the political will of one man - this time it was supported by the voice of a nation. Despite fairly significant resistance, eventually even the PB were swayed to the cause. Canada now has universal suffrage for all citizens.

Oh and I don't remember at which point I did this or even if I did it in an earlier update, but I have Proportional Income tax now, so every pop is taxed and equal portion of their total wealth. This helped to reduce the wealth gap.

Something truly revolutionary happened in Ontario. A man dug a hole in the ground and struck oil.

Oil turned out to have a broad set of applications, some of which remain undiscovered. For now we are primarily using it in our newly developed Furniture Manufactories using the Mechanized Workshops PM

We are able to churn out mountains of furniture every day. Oil has become more valuable than gold.

And since furniture manufactories can be built anywhere, I decided that the more remote parts of the country should share in the wealth. Even Nunavut has a healthy furniture industry at this point.

@makapse

didnt those thieving british overlords steal your oil too?

The Brits don't seem interested in this technology as of yet.

Later we also found a source of oil in Alberta

At this point the oil rigs in Ontario are the 3 most productive building in the world, measured by yearly productivity per employee. The profits are immense.

Daniel "neondt" Tolman

At this point the oil rigs in Ontario are the 3 most productive building in the world, measured by yearly productivity per employee. The profits are immense.

Oh I just researched Combustion Engines. After switching PM's in the oil rig, it's now the #1 most productive building in the world, generating £55,000 per week in profit.

Oil and furniture brought employment to many, many more people in Canada, raising SoL significantly

The Trade Unions got a new leader, and thus the country got a new governor. William Thompson is a Social Democrat - he believes in the achievement of socialism through reformist and electoral means.

His first act was to begin enacting Old Age Pensions, which passed on its first run through the legal system. Though this did slightly reduce the workforce ratio, this wasn't really a problem because there were already more people than available jobs. The benefit of this law was that the income and political participation of dependents increased drastically. And these newly "enfranchised" people supported the Unions.

@Kadaeux

Are you going from memory or did you write this down

Going from memory

With most IG's appeased by the recent passing of Women's Suffrage and the massive influx of new supporters for Thompson's socialist reforms, there was a brief window of opportunity to do the unthinkable. We enacted Council Republic through peaceful, legal means. (there was also a bug where the Industrialists failed to oppose the law, probably wouldn't have been able to do this otherwise). (edited)

Chairman William Thompson, leader of the People's Dominion of Canada, decreed a total reorganization of the nation's political system. Every workplace became a worker's co-operative - private ownership of industry was entirely abolished. Without the capitalist class taking the lion's share of profits for their own selfish use, business boomed. Nearly every industry saw an increase in profitability, and these profits were distributed among the workers. (edited)

The nation remains highly democratic and free. The electoral system has changed somewhat. Workers now elect delegates to local councils, and those local councils elect representatives to regional councils, who elect delegates to the central government. It's a very bottom-up system.

The total abolition of private ownership essentially abolished the capitalist class. There are however a few stragglers. I am playing the world's smallest violin.

OCR: Franco-Canadian Protestant Industrialists Saskatchewan Struggling Unemployed

@Jervaj

So capitalists and shopkeepers convert to other classes or leave?

Yep, they'll have to either get jobs or migrate elsewhere

Daniel "neondt" Tolman

Yep, they'll have to either get jobs or migrate elsewhere

They'll gradually convert to other pop types

@Jervaj

Does council republic also allow state ownership?

It does but my economic laws don't allow for that. I've stuck with Mercantilism.

Child labour was abolished, and the education system expanded. Oddly enough Canada never moved towards public systems of healthcare or education. Because my pops are so wealthy, private systems are actually more effective than public systems. I rationalize this as doctors and teachers having their own worker co-ops rather than being an arm of the government.

@Areoflop

What’s the average sol?

OCR: Standard of Canada Average: Prosperous (25.7) Living

OCR:

@Zembar

private hospital in this context presumably means the people working in it owns it

Yes, I expect the hospitals are collectively owned by the doctors, nurses, and administrators who work there. (edited)

Due to various mass migration movements and gradual assimilation, Anglo-Canadians now make up about half of the total population, which is more than it's been since we had that gigantic influx of migrants. That influx ended due to various factors, including the Intelligentsia now longer supporting government policies.

The population is sitting at 14 million, with an expected growth of about 3% per year.

@ThunderNorse

Talking of oil, do you still need coal?

We still need plenty of coal, though the industry isn't even close to as profitable as it was during the first coal boom

@Emperor Stafford Supporter

Is that high in vicky 3?

It's pretty average. Stable and unexciting.

We're not going to experience a population explosion any time soon.

Out of 14 million citizens, 8 million are Loyalists. The council system has the overwhelming support of the people.

Literacy is over 90%

The balance of power has shifted drastically. Where once Anglo-Canadians held disproportionate political power, each culture now has pretty much exactly equal power to their population share.

Things are not so equal when it comes to professions. Machinists are around 3x more powerful than their population share. Due to political disengagement Laborers are still only at about 2/3 of the population share. Peasants are totally disengaged and have no power - we've been working on abolition subsistence farming anyway. Engineers are also very powerful. Some engineers support the Industrialist IG, keeping that group relevant.

So that's it. Canada has become a socialist utopia and economic powerhouse through a triumph of democracy.

@Blackgold211

If interest groups can change policy does that mean you can get the bonus of immigration from intelligentsia while not dismantling everything/council republic

Potentially but not sure how I'll get the Intelligentsia to like me THAT much again. When I had that bonus they were in government and I was constantly passing policies they liked.

@Skelly Against Trains

You mean through a bugged industrialists IG

shhhh

@Emperor Stafford Supporter

It's not a bug, it's a feature that the industrialists were not invited to the chamber when the law was being signed

They were all asleep for a couple of years

@Skellius9(An-Staf-Wor-ism)

i'd like to think they are still mourning the loss of Mackenzie

Mackenzie was the Intelligentsia leader. Though for most of his terms of office the Industrialists were part of his coalition government.

@Thorius

Does Canada still not have armed forces?

None whatsoever.

Something I find quite interesting is how hugely my internal politics were affected by never developing agricultural industry. There are almost no farms in Canada at all. This would have made my life more difficult, as well as created a pretty different final state of internal politics. Farms employ aristocrats, farmers, and clergymen, who would have made the Devout, Landowners, and Rural Folk significant players while in my playthrough they were irrelevant for most of the game.

The Council Republic law also specifically empowers Machinists and Farmers. A more agrarian communist Canada would have to contend with a very powerful Rural Folk IG

@Thorius

Do farms always creat Aristocrats? For example in the US where in large parts the medium sized family farm was dominant (similiar to Southern and Western Germany later on) it make no sense for there to be Aristocrats employed in farms

Not always! You can transition them to private ownership instead later on so they're owned by capitalists.

Daniel "neondt" Tolman

Not always! You can transition them to private ownership instead later on so they're owned by capitalists.

And of course with a worker co-op it's owned by farmers primarily

GB knows that attempting to mess with me would be a terrible idea. They are utterly economically dependent.

@Thorius

Is it possible to be split? Like in the USA, where there is private ownership in the North and quasi aristocratic slave plantations in the south? (Similiar to Prussia, where aristocratic farms dominate east of the Elbe, while the Rhine Province is mostly medium sized family farms.

Absolutely

AAR : Lubeck Kiel - Pt.1 - by Paul "PDJR_Alastorn" Depre

So if anyone want to know - I've decided on a little suicide pact game. I'm playing as Lubeck - I am going to try and see if I can survive as North North Prussia (I've not tried this in some time)

Because while I am not suffering devastation as the frontline, my shared state trade and infrastructure is seeing issues.

No one wants to migrate to a city near a warzone

AAR : Lubeck Kiel - Pt.2 - by Paul "PDJR_Alastorn" Depre

Evening all, as soon as I am done being headbutted by a cat who has decided now is the time for attention. I will be starting Lubeck back up for a bit. Been out ill today, but still want to do some slowplay and tinker with a few things though remember its unlikely for the revolutions and that to be majorly fixed in my build.

The good news is its not covid, hopefully with one more day of rest I will be feeling well enough to work.

But yeah the bug I stopped for yesterday is still there so I did some commands to make it... go away for now.

Alright, for those who need an update - its 1843. We are playing as Lubeck and have gone from a city state to cities state.

The world is going to hell and a handbasket, but our little merchant town is doing alright. So well we can turn off our consumption taxes and enjoy a bit of an eco boom off of it

Just shy of a million GDP - and we are reaching state limits on resource and agricultural buildings, so time to start using production methods to pump more value into the economy.

Since I now make ships, time for fisheries to utilize ships, because I 1 - Need more fish 2 - That's going to increase ship demand 3 - Which will increase fabric and wood demand 4 - Which are also in my market! I win multiple ways!

Well... except for anyone who was just getting by... like the furniture factory. Its gonna loose some profit

I am calculating the loss of sol for the clothes factory will be overcome by the increase in wages and sol in the other factories

But this is just an estimation, I am yet to see if this is true.

We are just about 650k pops. And one cat advisor (excuse me a moment)

So... Cut fish consumption taxes, increased fishing production. Fish still ended up as more expensive because the number of pops who got an SoL increase bought more fish.

while not problematic, it is something I will have to make sure doesn't get too much higher relatively.

Working on cattle for fabric + meat subsitution, which will also make clippers a bit cheaper, etc.

All my industries are currently privately owned

Shipyards have quickly supplanted tools as the most profitable industry

The revenge of the clipper factory* Remember that my economy is still small, its only 3-4 factories atm

I... just got Vasa'd (edited)

Who the hell wrote this.

No, its just funny.

To me it feels like the Vasa, but its clearly a ships of the time event.

Because my industrialists were like "to celebrate our shipping industry we need to build a GIANT SHIP"

It did not go well

Definitely could use a little polish because it felt like it just took off and sank.

So felt more Vasa than Titanic

For those of you who don't know - the Vasa was a Swedish Royal ship that never made it out of the harbor.

anyways, that made me laugh

So... dropping consumption taxes and telling industries to buy complementary industry goods. little to no pop change, all of a sudden my GDP is up 50%

Is that real evaluation? No, its mostly inflationary prices, but still that number makes me look more prestigious - and I need Prussia to like me enough to allow me in their market

Dr.healthy

will they kick u out if your not continuously improving relations

Not 100% sure, I will have to maintain some level of relations but not max all the time. I still have to border them and not be a minor power so it depends on how far I am able to achieve in that regard first.

@Ccrt

Wow, what do you mean with "complementary industry goods"? Its like buying better hammers or better mechanical tools in general?

I am having my fisheries use clippers to produce more, I am making clippers domestically, those clippers are using wood, tools and fabric from the domestic market.

That entire production line is local, the wages stay at home - those wages get spent on fish and other goods.

Its entirely dependent upon the product and comparative advantage.

I can do this semi-autarky due to my home resources.

BTW, Denamrk is in Rebellion (again).

Time to see if Schleswig-Holstein can become Lubeckian

Me?

I have a national militia only.

I keep making entreaties to Prussia and Austria to protect me

And Prussia is willing to consider, now its to make sure Austria stays out of it

I am toeing the line of upsetting Germany's Balance, but nothing too major has been done.

I don't think they can hear the Danes over the giant figurative bag of money I just plopped on the ambassador's desk.

(I did not actually bribe them, I just made entreaties of obligations)

Ones I hope they never ask for

The favor system will bite you in the butt if you are not careful

I am totally gambling.

But I also know that Denmark just had a revolution fire - they are not willing to fight two wars and with Austria on my side and Prussia leaning me they capitulated.

Lloyien

It may take you a few more steps maybe to find out why this is a problem, but tooltips in tooltips and the mapmodes make things relatively intuitive.

Like to figure out that the issue was I was importing no iron was looking at my industry shortage notification -> seeing iron was expensive -> going to my market trade routes -> seeing no trade incoming -> going to prussian market -> noticing all the isolated market zones due to the war.

And it was obvious every step of the way.

Importing stuff from abroad is meaning that my industries are paying the wages of foreign workers

That's the kind of logic you would have plaguing you in V2 all the time.

Its seeing high transportation costs and is going "I need more railways" but not recognizing the high cost is not due to low production itself due to output potential but is due to a shortage of steel specifically, which is shorting locomotives, etc. (edited)

It figured it out eventually (its building steel now) but it may have overcompensated in railroads a bit too long.

@Roses [Vanguardist-Staffordist]

Oh hey Paul, do you mind telling what your economics degree specialises in?

Asking me what I specialized in is hard. My paper was official on the compounding inflationary trends of the monetary policy of the people's bank of china, the political reasoning behind it, and the future sustainability of that policy. But ultimately it was a Macroeconomics focus with Historical Economics being my favorite pet subjects, (I did all the micro, I just don't like micro)

But I also minored in International Relations, History, and Accounting because up until the end I didn't know what I was going to do - I just wanted to do all of it.

Brad

IR fellow gang member

I was going to major in IR originally, but then I found that I liked IR because of the economics behind why people made decisions so I switched majors. Still not 100% certain my advisor has ever fully forgiven me

AAR : Lubeck Kiel - Pt.3 - by Paul "PDJR_Alastorn" Depre

I may have fixed the visual bug - we will see if it creates any stability issues running at higher force. And yes I noticed many of you commented on the Capital moving to Kiel though we are technically Lubeck.

Capitals are based in the main city hub by default, lubeck is technically a port hub (visual clarifications on map). This is the intended default - much like with namable factories and entities we want to look into making capitals be a bit more moveable and customizable but that's lower priority. (edited)

OCR: Kiel weeks 2+1

Alright, things look as stable as they can be with the world on fire due to revolution and turmoil. Last time we looked at Lubeck - we were moving to Trains and Steel, and we will be continuing work on those endeavors because we've plateau'd our industry. I can't just throw pops at the factories anymore, I need to make things more efficient.

If you want to know how bad the turmoil is in parts of the world. The most recently free Revolutionary Brittany just had its own uprising.

Yagami913

Turmoil spread through borders?

Its less a mechanic but I think its 1 of 2 things working here (not sure if intended or not). Split states can currently cause some calculation issues

But because that part of the state is having issues regardless, its not contributing to the general market. We already know their split state turmoil effects migration and infrastructure retention in my part of the state (from the early part of the AAR with Holstein)

So their turmoil is causing trade + resource efficiency issues which is itself causing turmoil in my state (I believe)

Which makes migration to all the new factories harder to sell

The game is under development

There are plenty of issues

And we are working on them

I think this one is less a "functional bug" and more a "we could provide this information better" bug

AAR : Greece - Greece by Paul "PDJR_Alastorn" Depre

1836 - Greece is in a rough state, its economy is tiny, its military large, its bureaucracy unable to cope.

We owe obligations to France, UK, and Russia.

We have a truce with the Ottomans.

Our goal - to recover Greek Homelands and surpass the Sick Man of Europe.

OCR: -147 700 -840 € 6.42K 700.7K 17.70 10.5 939K Belgraue Sarajevo

Obligations are Favors.

I am a Kingdom, but a minor power in the world.

One of the first things I need to do is rebalance.

The truce with the Ottomans means prime time to build a domestic industry - put in place laws and get reforms moving.

I'm going to make money fueling an empire's war economy - and then start my own army.

I'm debating 2 ideas for markets. Either British or Ottoman

Stay with me, if I join the Ottoman market, I can try and pull my own greek pops back to Greece.

That's what I am thinking.

I've got a year, not enough time to put up defenses, but enough time for some diplomacy

I'm thinking Russia and England are people to sway.

In fact GBR would already offer a protectorate.

Before we find a GP to protect us, we need to focus on our economy a bit - as its weakness is hurting our relations.

But a delegation has been sent to both London and St. Petersburg

Going to try and avoid consumption taxes atm so I can use the authority to push through some reforms faster

I'm going to need to make Greece a bit of a decent sol to pull in migrants once I need that

Protectorate is a subject relationship that still has fairly high autonomy for me as Greece.

GB can start a diplo play to reduce my autonomy in the future, but I am hoping it will not come to that.

Not able to join the British Market Customs Union atm, but by swearing as a protectorate its much more likely.

Doing Hospitals atm because I intend to go heavy into Iron and mining mortality is a thing I wish to avoid

Protectorate does not grant you a "I'm under X nation" flag

I've got Wood, Iron, Lead, Sulfur, various agricultural products.

A little bit of everything but nothing in abundence.

Might have to focus hard on production tech to compensate

I pay nothing, except I've given GB the chance to start a play to erode my authority and make me a puppet.

I gain the security that regardless of whether GB has an interest in th e med, they are able to come to my defense.

Correct

Its given them a bit of a bump to relations, so I'm hoping to use that to convince them.

AI strategies and objectives mostly.

Ideological differences was originally standing in the way of us cemeting a customs union.

Now I need to make sure I have convoys and ports setup before I say yes

Otherwise that will be bad.

No but I'm not exactly running on a good balance atm

@Dewit

ok, why cant you sell your goods profitably? due to market access or inefficient production method or something else?

When you are only 5% of the production of X good and 95% is being driven by labor and production costs elsewhere in the market and your wages start stagflating because of losing a qualified laborforce.

Your increased wages are not going to have enough draw to increase prices of the goods, you just go out of business.

Numbers are for example. (edited)

@DarkLordDae

Like in real world counterparts, it's designed for the more industrious and stronger economies to benefit.

Construction is based on labor and costs of goods. Terrain effects infrastructure efficiency.

Its not that you need more, its that you get less for your value. Which is an interesting way of saying "it continually costs more"

OCR: 50.0 80.0 +540 €-L12K 3.7M 46.20 11.9 11SM 43.2K 113K

Not too shabby

AAR : Martin's Ottoman Official AAR - Martin's Ottoman Official AAR by Martin "Wiz" Anward

I will start the AAR here in little more than 30 minutes. As I play, I'll be taking screenshots quite a bit and trying to answer some questions from the AAR chat channel (the answers will be written here). Since this is the first 'official' AAR, I'd just like to remind people that I will be playing on hot code, so while the aim is to play for about 8 hours (with a break or two), there's a chance my game might become unstable or otherwise break. If this happens, I'll try to pick it up or restart it at a later time.

I will be playing as the Ottomans, with the goal of building up a rural-based economy, maintaining conservative values and a traditional power structure while also trying to reform and strengthen the empire and retake lost lands.

It's OK to ping me in v3-aar-general-chat to ask questions, just be aware that I will not answer every question. How many I answer will depend on how many there are and how much time it takes away from playing - it might be just a few, it might be a lot. With that in mind, please don't spam the same question.

Alright, it's time to start!

This is me, the Ottoman Empire of 1836, also known as the Sick Man of Europe. Now, you might be wondering how I got into this situation.

OCR: +77.6 +435 +1.02K € +1Z.8K January 7, 1836 Tuesday Morning 17.7M 18.900 9.0 19.SM 4.39K 575 (Paused) 0/20 Nothing Under Construction 'fanore Active Journal Entries The Sick Man of Europe The Sick Man of Europe 84 days Markets Austria Turkish Market Wallachia Serbia Sea Konya Ottoman Empire) Turkish Market (100% Market Access; +12 Infrastructure) Strategic Region: Anatolia Right-click to open Context Menu 7 { 62FPS Prus sia Annen Prussiz Goxum} Eelgim Bavaria 0 Cizerimd ~Ra Caspian Black 8ea Laruantic K h i v a Seu 6 Ottoman Bukhara 0 mpire Medlite Tanean Persia Afgh Seh Persian Tripolitania

OCR: The Sick Man of Europe Event in Thrace The Ottoman Empire is in a period of steady decline: If we do not reassert Ottoman sovereignty and reclaim our place among the Powers of the world, we risk catastrophe: We have fallen, but we can rise again. In an Auspicious Incident we deposed the Janissaries who had maintained their miserly grip on power for centuries, finally allowing reform to possible. is much more to do. First, of course, we need to replace the Janissaries with truly modern military force. But in addition; we must restore the place of the Sublime Porte as the very height of civilization. Education, urbanization, and sovereignty shall be the top items of the Ottoman agenda. Great reform is needed. There

There are those who would say that the Empire is outdated, outmoded, left behind by the European Great Powers due to archaic laws and customs such as the Jizya taxes or the largely agrarian economy. They would insist that the Empire needs to modernize, liberalize and industrialize, reform itself along Western lines by limiting the power of the monarch and giving that power to his subjects. To those people I say only one thing: pfah

OCR: +77.6 +435 1.02K { +17.8K January 7,1836 Tuesday Morning 17.7M 18.900 9.0 19.SM 439K 575 (Paused) POLITICS Active Jou The Overview Government Laws Institutions Power Structure Economy Human Rights Market Turkis Governance Principles Economic System Free Speech Monarchy Traditionalism 1 Censorship A Distribution of Power Trade Policy Labor Rights Autocracy 0 Mercantilism 0 Serfdom Abolished 2 Citizenship Taxation Children' s Rights Cultural Exclusion 0 Land-Based Taxation Child Labor Allowed A A Church and State Colonization Rights of Women State Religion 0 No Colonial Affairs 0 Legal Guardianship 4 Bureaucracy Welfare Hereditary Bureaucrats 0 No Police No Social 0 7 Army Model Education System Migration Peasant Levies 0 No Schools 02 No Migration Controls Nev Internal Security Health System Slavery No Home Affairs No Health System Slave Trade Nev Ac New New New Nev 163 FPS Policing Security

OCR: 'UTTOMAN -MPIRE Country Information Modifiers Diplomacy 145 p RTH 25 Timed Modifiers @€EAN Sick Man of Europe Remaining Time: Never E17,.7 25.0% Prestige Population 19.5M Literacy 18.9% Standard of Living Struggling 9.00) State Religion Sunni Government: Sultanate Primary Cultures Turkish Arable Land 30.5% 678 Infamy Reputable

OCR: cTTOMAN -MPIRE Country -KIL-AN Information Modifiers Diplomacy 145 25 Timed Modifiers Cizye Tax GDP Remaining Time: Never 17.7M +0.50 € Land Tax 40% Conscription rate Population 19.5M Literacy 18.9% Standard of Living Struggling 9.00) State Religion Sunni Government: Sultanate Primary Cultures Turkish Arable Land 30.5%6 678 Infamy Reputable Xiiant

OCR: ~OTTOMAN -MPIRE Country -ALILANTIL Information Modifiers Diplomacy 145 25 Timed Modifiers Outmoded Bureaucracy GDP Remaining Time: Never {17.7M ~25% Bureaucracy Population 19.SM Literacy 18.906 Standard of Struggling 9.00) State Religion Sunni Government: Sultanate Cultures Turkish Arable Land 30.5%6 Infamy Reputable AAN " Living Prinary

It is true that the Empire is weak, and in need of some reform. But the reason for that has nothing to do with our traditional ways of ruling, and everything to do with weak rulers who have allowed Western influences to creep into and weaken our realm. We will reform, and cast off the title of Sick Man, but we will do so in our own way, without losing who we are. We will crush the separatist movements, strengthen the army and retake Syria from the rebellious Governor of Egypt.

OCR: Journal Decisions Active Journal Entries The Sick Man of Europe The Sick Man of Europe Will complete if: X Complete 4 'Tanzimat' Journal Entries Tanzimat: Reclaim Syria Starting a diplomatic play against Egypt will give European Will time out in 19 years Great Powers an Active Interest in the region: If completed: Ottoman Empire oses Sick Man of Europe Tanzimat: Urbanization -25.0% Prestige Triggers the Event Tanzimat: The Reorganization Tanzimat: Education Reform If time runs out: Ottoman Empire loses Sick Man of Europe Tanzimat: Suppress Separatism -25.0% Prestige Triggers the Event The Dead Man of Europe Tanzimat: Modernization Tanzimat: Bureaucratic Reform Potential Journal Entries Religion, Autocracy, Nationality Kiie Cer Lnc Army

(Note: Jizya tax says Land Tax but it's actually a tax on Heathen pops)

Meet our primary antagonist, at least in the short term. Even though Egypt is rightfully an Ottoman province, and Muhammed Ali nominally recognizes our overlordship, in practice he rules an independent state that has conquered Syria and made the Hedjaz into a protectorate.

OCR: cGYPT Country Information Modifiers Diplomacy 129 39 Wallachia Timed Modifiers GDP {7.84M Population 9.33M Literacy 20.7% Standard of Impoverished (10.26) State Religion Sunni Government: Khedivate Cultures Misri Arable Land 46.8%6 360 Attitude Relations Infamy 7 f Belligerent Cold Reputable 9 Strategies Agricultural Conservative Defend the Investmnents Agenda Borders Black 8Bea mpire (ean Living Sel Prinary 2 2

Egypt was able to defeat us largely due to the poor state of the Ottoman army. Instead of maintaining a professional and well-equipped force, we rely heavily on a semi-feudal system of irregulars, which means that while on paper our army is quite large (and relatively cheap to maintain) it hasn't stood up well to Egypt's western-style forces. Our artillery is also outdated, and we depend on foreign imports to supply it.

OCR: GARRACKS in Thrace Information Workforce Modifiers Status: Active Employment: 25.0K Government Expenses: 7.28K Mobilized Battalions: 0 / 25 (0.00%) fia 25 bia Battalions Production Methods Greecc Murat Karaosmanoglu Garrisoned Process Weekly Balance: 0.7.28K Building` ptton ra

We have claims on them, and this will tie into events that might come later.

Struggling is worse than impoverished

Our finances are okay-ish at the moment. Our main sources of income are land/jizya and consumption taxes.

OCR: Money Balance: € +17.8K 4 Gold Reserves 2.35M Investment Pool: 0.00 (Change: € 0.00} National Revenue: +113K [+27.6K Income Taxes [+54.0K Poll Taxes [+18.0K Consumption Taxes [+3.92K Tariffs {+9.1OK Minting {+762 Diplomatic Pacts National Expenses: $.95.6K f-1L1K Goods for Government Buildings 5.30.5K Government [.20.6K Goods for Buildings {.31.9K Wages [-127K Construction Wages {-58.0 Subsidies Balance +18.7K OOK 1 Jan, 1836 7 Jan, 1836 Gold Reserves 2.37M 5,09M Jan; 836 7 Jan, 1836 Wages Military Military

We are a Major Power, with some potential to become a Great Power if we can get rid of the hefty prestige penalty from Sick Man of Europe. We have an old rivalry with Russia, and we maintain loose overlordship of Wallachia, Moldavia, Serbia and Tunis, as well as firmer control of Tripoli

OCR: cIPLOMACY ustria Major Power Wallachia Serhia Overview Release Subject Interest in Danubia Balkans Arabia Anatolia [ Se Caucasus North Africa Diplomatic Status Rivalty Protectorate Puppet Truces Bmaria Ottoman Madlita ranean Tripolitania Tibesti, A i r

Our first reform goal will be to Modernize the Army. There's a lot of areas we don't want to emulate the West in, but the army is one of them, as it's clear that we have no chance of reclaiming Syria, Egypt and our other lost territories otherwise. To do this, there's a few things we're going to need to do: - Switch our Barracks from Irregulars to Line Infantry. This will require us to acquire a large supply of Small Arms. - Research Napoleonic Warfare, and switch our artillery to Mobile Artillery. This means we need to fix our supply issues of Artillery. - Build up a proper army reserve. To do this, we will need to reform our archaic levy system and either acquire more people to conscript, or increase our conscription rate by abolishing Jizya.

OCR: Though the Janissaries have been disbanded, there is far more that must be done to modernize Our armed forces. Will complete if: Ottoman Army Reserves are greater or to 250 Ottoman Empire has researched Napoleonic Warfare All Ottoman Buildings: Currently, 144 fulfill this requirement At least one of these: Building is NOT Barracks All of these: Has NOT activated Irregular Infantry Has NOT activated Focus Has NOT activated Cannon Artillery equal Infantry

We currently have a single Arms Industry building, which is at level 3. Building up our domestic Arms Industry is going to be critical here, so my first move is to expand it and order the construction of a second Arms Industry in Rumelia

The Armed Forces are currently not huge fans of us, mainly because they think our traditional army is weakening their ability to fight wars. I happen to agree with this, so we're going to give them a chance to make some changes.

We invite them into the government. This opens up an opportunity to reform our army model. This is actually quite a popular idea, many of the IGs approve of it either inherently or because of their leader's ideology. However, the Landowners oppose it, which is going to make it somewhat tricky to pass while they're in the government. We're certainly not going to take their Allah-given right to rule away however, so we'll just have to try and convince them.

I reformed the government to bring in the army, which has effects on Legitimacy. Adding more people to government generally isn't a problem, kicking them out however can create quite a few radicals if it's not viewed as legitimate.

Sardinia-Piedmont is exporting our much-needed artillery. I am not happy about this as it's going to cause shortages for us, so I'm going to embargo Artillery. Embargoing means that we establish a protected share of our Artillery that can't be exported from our market, and costs Influence to maintain.

OCR: Import Route for Artillery Feb 7 Sardinia-Piedmont started an Import Route, moving 32 0 Artillery from the Turkish Market to the Piedmontian Market. eidl

I also embargo small arms while I'm at it. Ottomans guns are for Ottoman soldiers!

I still feel like I'm hurting for construction, so I'm going to build a few more levels of construction sector in populous states.

A look at our market, from most sell orders to least. I may have overdone the tools exports.

Costs money and uses construction materials, driving up their price.

OCR: wrath Idag 17:12 @Martin Wiz" Anward downsides to building say; construction centers

On the earlier topic of Diplomacy, we automatically have Interests (the ability to start and participate in Diplomatic Plays) anywhere we or one of our subjects have territory. We've also declared an interest in Egypt, Persia and the Dnieper region.

OCR: Declare Interest Select which Strategic Region to declare an R Interest in (3/3) Press ESC to close current Map Interaction Status Title Nile Basin Dnieper Austiia Kazakhs Persia 7 UD Qck-Seu Ia Sel gh A i 1 5 PTU8 K h i Va (toniu _ Bokhtr;; mpire misn eria Tal;UI Persia: 6 Tripolitani; 1 0 #l 1 Hemen 6 Sokoto

AAR : Emu War Journal Modding - Emu War Journal Modding by Daniel "neondt" Tolman

Today we're gonna make a journal entry

A Journal Entry about the most significant historical conflict of the period our game covers

That of course being the Emu War

@Mppqlmd

emu wars ?

Wow you actually called it

So first up we need to make a new journal entry in the journal entries folder

OCR: je__ emu war { H

Easy enough

But we've got some design decisions to make

We need to decide under what circumstances this should be shown in the Journal and when it ought to activate

According to my academic source, wikipedia.org, the conflict was confined to Western Australia, which is also a State Region in Victoria 3

However, emus seem to have a natural range that extends far beyond that single state

OCR: DROMAIUS NOVAEHOLLANDIAE Emu's recorded observations map (Dromaius Novaehollandiae). Areas where emu has been recorded.

So there's three ways we could go here in terms of the scope of the content: 1. Historical. It happened in Western Autralia so it'll be there in V3. This is not really consistent with our design philosophy. 2. Dynamic. We could pick a random Australian state that meets a set of appropriate conditions. 3. Universal. We represent a broader emu-human conflict across all applicable Australian states. I'm torn between 2 and 3

@Stretchy

Maybe any state will developed farms gets emu attention since if I remember right the problem was caused by them going away from their normal migration paths to eat farms

I like this. Sounds like a compromise between options 2 and 3

Oh and we should also decide who can get this content. Two approaches here: 1. Restrict to countries with Australian primary culture 2. Available to anyone who owns an applicable state

I think option 2 is fine, but not without its downsides. Those being that this fairly small and honestly quite silly content wouldn't be super appropriate if the player is e.g. a massive expansionist Japanese empire.

But the people have spoken

So now we've got the conditions under which this should appear in the journal

OCR: je_emu_war potential { any_scope_state { is_in_australia yes # TODO actually Write this scripted trigger NOT { state_region STATE_ TASMANIA free_arable_land # check that farming has been extensively developed in the state H

In fact, this is better. Here we've separated the conditions for having the content appear in the journal vs the conditions for activation. So you'll see this as an inactive journal entry if you own an Australian state, and you'll be told that it will activate once you've extensively developed agriculture in one of them

OCR: je_emu war { potential { any_scope_state is_in_australia yes # TODO actually Write this scripted trigger NOT state_region STATE_TASMANIA possible any_scope_state is_in_australia yes # TODO actually write this scripted trigger NOT state_region STATE TASMANIA free_arable_land # check that farming has been extensively developed in the state

@Arctem | Horse Mod

5 seems very very low. Is that likely to happen? Though I guess this is a very late game event, historically.

Yes that's why it's so low. I considered even making it 0. Northern Australia has so little arable land that it wouldn't be at all hard to do

Daniel "neondt" Tolman

Yes that's why it's so low. I considered even making it 0. Northern Australia has so little arable land that it wouldn't be at all hard to do

You know what, we can account for that. I've added triggers for the total amount of arable land needed in the state for this to be relevant

OCR: je_emu war { potential { any_scope_state { is_in_australia yes # TODO actually Write this scripted trigger NOT { state_region STATE_TASMANIA arable_land 15 possible { any_scope_state is_in_australia yes # TODO actually write this scripted trigger NOT {state_region STATE TASMANIA arable_land 15 free_arable_land 5 # check that farming has been extensively developed in the state

@Archemide | I don't know history

Maybe a percentage of arable land has been developed?

I think narratively we're going with the idea that you've developed your agriculture so much that you're encroaching upon core emu territory, so I'm happy with the triggers we have

@Mppqlmd

the minimum of 15 arable land is to avoid it to fire on a tiny little treaty port ?

That wasn't what I was thinking, but it actually does account for that situation as well!

We're also going to scope this content in terms of time. I think timeout = 1825 is appropriate here. I'm thinking that you'll have 5 years to either resolve the problem or fail to do so.

I've fleshed out the overall design a little more and more or less completed the journal entry script itself. So upon activation an event will fire, as well as on completion and on the timeout

OCR: je_emu war { potential { any_scope_state is_in_australia yes # TODO actually Write this scripted trigger NOT {state_region STATE_TASMANIA arable_land 15 possible any_scope_state is_in_australia yes # TODO actually write this scripted trigger NOT { state STATE_ TASMANIA arable_land 15 free_arable_land 5 # check that farming has been extensively developed in the state immediate trigger_event { id emu_war.1 } complete { 222 on_complete trigger_event { id emu_war timeout 1825 on_timeout trigger_event { id emu war.3 region

We still need completion triggers though

OCR: Google days in 5 years All Images News Videos Shopping More Tools About 6 390 0O0 OOO results (0,59 seconds) Time 5 1825 Calendar year Day Formula multiply the time value by 365

@Stabbystab

Wait your actually doing it I thought you were joking about it

I would never joke about such a serious topic

@Yagami913

too bad i cant just write 365*5

Would be nice if it took a larger unit of time but it doesn't

I'm not sure yet what the completion triggers will be. But just like some authors are "discovery writers" and write to find out for themselves what will happen next, I'm a "discovery scripter". Let's start writing the events and see what happens

This is the empty shell of a V3 event. Should look very familiar to you if you've ever done modding for a PDS game

OCR: trigger { triggered by je_emu War start immediate option name emu_war.1.a default_option yes option { name emu war 1.b

@Lloyien

Can you still define the name and description in the event itself, or does that need to be done in a localization file, Daniel?

Yeah that's all there as well above. Didn't show it because it's not interesting to us right now

Destroying the farms wouldn't be a good option imo. The player shouldn't be encouraged to un-develop their country

I've made a start just going by what felt obvious. So we've selected a random state to be the "epicenter" of the Emu War, and which we'll be using in the event text. I've also gone ahead and save the Rural Folk since I'm pretty sure they'll be relevant here as well. In the event option (maybe we'll have multiple), all owned states that meet the conditions will get a negative agricultural throughput modifier.

OCR: immediate random_scope_state limit { is_in_australia yes # TODO actually write this scripted trigger NOT {state_region STATE_TASMANIA arable_land 15 free_arable_land # check that farming has been extensively developed in the state save_scope_as emu_war_ epicenter ig:ig_rural_folk save_scope_as emu war farmers option name emu_war 1.a default_option yes every_scope_state limit in_australia yes # TODO actually Write this scripted trigger NOT {state_ STATE_ TASMANIA arable_land 15 free_arable_land 5 # check that farming has been extensively developed in the state add_modifier { # agricultural throughput name emu wars_modifier is_ Lregion

Alright I think I've decided that rather than deciding how you approach a solution to the emus in the event option, the JE should tell you about what you can do and leave you to it. So we need to come up with pro-active player actions that make sense in this context (edited)

Throughout 1930 and onward, exclusion barrier fencing became a popular means of keeping emus out of agricultural areas (in addition to other vermin, such as dingoes and rabbits).[23][12] - according to our good friend Wikipedia, fences were an effective means of combating the emu threat. There are a couple of fencing PM's that farms can use, so that would make sense as a trigger.

We should also have a more militaristic option

@Viligans

If motorization is a PM for barracks, maybe have at least 1 local state barracks have Motorization & machine guns as PMs selected? Represent having access to the jeeps and machine guns to "fight the war", so to speak?

I quite like this

And doing it in the local state means you can't just rely on a huge military complex in your capital

Alright I think we have our completion conditions!

OCR: complete every_scope_state limit { hasmodifier emu war_modifier OR any scope_building { is building_type building_livestock_ranch has_ active_production_method pm_electric_fencing level >= 10 any_ scope_ building is_building_type building_barracks has_active_production_method pm_mechanized_infantry level 7=

So, all of your states that have been afflicted with the emu modifier need to EITHER have livestock ranches with advanced fences, or barracks with mechanized infantry

There's a bit of an issue with this trigger though: it can be completed instantly

The player can just turn on these PM's and the whole thing will be over in an instant

Even if their economy can't really support it

There's a solution to that

@Archemide | I don't know history

Maintain them for a year?

Exactly. I'm thinking 3 years

So we've got some slightly more complicated scripting to do now

@Archemide | I don't know history

That would mean you only have 2 years to get them running?

The Emu War is an imminent crisis that must be addressed as a matter of urgency!

@Arctem | Horse Mod

Do the buildings just need to exist or is there a way to make sure they are actually operating at a high capacity?

We can check for things like profitability and employment, but I don't think that's really what this content is about

The Journal Entry is now a lot more technically complicated. I'll run through it in parts

This section deals with what happens when the JE activates. First off we're setting a variable called emu_war_war, and tracking that variable is how we're going to determine the player's success.

OCR: immediate { set_variable name emu war var value trigger_event { id emu war.1

And we've added this whole new section. This creates a monthly pulse that enacts an effect if the triggers return true. So if the player is meeting the completion requirements at the time of the monthly pulse, the variable is advanced by 1.

OCR: on_monthly_pulse { effect { if = limit every_scope_state limit has_modifier emu war_modifier OR any_scope_building { is_building_type building_livestock_ranch has_active_production_method pm_electric_fencing level 7= 10 any_scope_building is_building_type building_barracks has_ active_production_method pm_mechanized_infantry level >= 5 change_variable { name emu_ war_ var add

This script tells the journal entry that we're interested in tracking the emu_war_var variable as a completion condition, and then tells it that we want this variable to be advanced by 36 (so 3 years worth of monthly successes). Finally since we have the functionality to do so, I've added a progress bar that will show your progress towards advancingthe variable to completion

OCR: current_value { root.var emu_war_var goal_add_value add 36 progressbar yes

@Archemide | I don't know history

Do we maybe want 2 separate variables to track progress for each? If I do 1 year of machine guns while I get tech to do 2 years of electric fences, I get the fence 'ending'?

I think we can keep things simple in the script here. But what we totally can do is look at the ending conditions and apply effects based on what the player did. A mix of both approaches could have additional rewards or consequences

Oh and we'll throw this in before QA yells at me about what happens if you lose all your emu wars states

OCR: invalid { NOT { any_scope_state { has_modifier emu war_modifier } }

@Archemide | I don't know history

Is there a way to check historically though? You wouldn't want the player to swap everything to the ending they want for just the last month, when they were doing one for the other 2.9 years

Sure, we could do it that way. But after a certain point you don't get much additional value out of extra complexity and imo that would cross the line in terms of cost vs benefit. As with all things in game development, time and maintainability are important things to consider

@Arctem | Horse Mod

Could this Journal trigger simultaneously for multiple nations controlling different parts of Australia?

I don't see why not!

Oh and I recall someone mentioning earlier about what happens if the player doesn't have the tech for the solutions. Since this is very much intended to be later game content, we can simply gate it all behind actually having these techs

@General_WCJ

Chance of getting new art with this journal?

Zero

@Alex "Alex" Hesseborn

ooh, it's PDT tomorrow. might try my hand at making a few events

Let me know if you want any help

@Arctem | Horse Mod

I mean, is it that bad if it triggers early enough that they can't feasibly solve it (or have to go hard on the right techs)?

I think generally if we're presenting players with content it's a lot less fun if they don't have ways to meaningfully interact with it. There are some cases where this is acceptable, but this is the emu wars - fun is the goal

I'm now going to take the time actually actually create the is_in_australia trigger since that's kind of critical to this actually working

There we go. Now other CD's, as well as modders, have a convenient way to check if a state is in Australia

OCR: state_is_in_australia { custom_tooltip { text state_is_in_australia_tt state OR THIS STATE_NEW_SOUTH_WALES THIS STATE VICTORIA THIS STATE_QUEENSLAND THIS STATE SOUTH_AUSTRALIA THIS STATE_WESTERN_AUSTRALIA THIS STATE NORTHERN TERRITORY THIS STATE_TASMANIA region

@atreides18

Could you not just have a continent variable or something and check if the continent is Australia?

That would include New Zealand and probably a bunch of Pacific islands

@Archemide | I don't know history

What if the emus built boats to go to those islands though?

Then I weep for humanity

@Lloyien

Hey Daniel, out of curiosity, can you think of any really clever ways you might add arable land to a state by way of a building's production method?

The UI would be a bit weird but you could do it with a journal entry. Make a JE when you build the building, then on monthly/yearly/whatever tick, increase arable land if the building is sufficiently staffed etc

@Solid Scrooge

How did you deterime how much arable land each state should have in 1836?

I leave that to my minions

I think we've just barely got functional enough script to try launching the game

Daniel "neondt" Tolman

I think we've just barely got functional enough script to try launching the game

I expect to have slipped up somewhere so the error log will likely complain at me

First round of deubbing: missing a bunch of s: 's in state region triggers

Going through various rounds of uninteresting debugging

Debugging continues..

@Mikezero

Any updates on debugging?

The error log is getting smaller

Oh finally the error log is gone

There are no bugs in my script!

(that I know about)

Yeah might as well just ship the game right now

So we've ended up with this

OCR: The Emu War Will activate if: Western Australian State Is in Australia state_region_equal has no localization Arable land greater than 15 Available arable land less than 5 Western Australia has researched Electrical Generation Western Australia has researched Mobile Armor Will complete if: The following must be true for a total of three years: Exactly 100% of all Western Australian States (Currently 0.00%) At least one of these: Any Building: Building is Livestock Ranches Has activated Electric Fences none_level_greater_or_equal has no localization Building: Building is Barracks Has activated Mechanized Infantry none_level_greater_or_equal has no localization Will become invalid if: All Western Australian State Does NOT have modifier MODIFIER Will time out in 5 years If activated: Triggers the Event The Emu War Debug: This Journal Entry has some sort of OnPulse Any" Any

A bunch of this is just general TODO loc and that's not something I'm gonna fix today

@Kot (Anti Staffordist Texan)

Why not

Laziness

But it looks like everything is basically in order, unreadability aside. That's stuff for polish later and doesn't really progress this AAR

Let's try to activate it with console commands (edited)

I'll also comment out a few triggers to make this easier. Don't need to do this organically

@Alex "Alex" Hesseborn

"Does not have modifier MODIFIER", my nemesis

I'm not even sure why that happens

Here we go

OCR: The Emu War Event in Western Australia The Rural Folk of Western Australia complain that a legion of emus is ruining Australian agriculture: Emu noises Emu Field Marshall Isuppose we ought to deal with this: Western Australia gets Emu Infestation for 0 days ~20.0% Agriculture Throughput DEBUG: Open Event in text editor DEBUG: Trigger description Event ID: emu_ war.1 2 South Australia

@Wish "WishList" Pig

Why is there no option to coexist with the emus?

Humanity cannot co-exist with the emus

All that's really left to do now (besides a whole bunch of polish and actual writing) is write the remaining 2 events - one for success and one for failure

btw you can determine where an event is placed on the map using saved scopes like so

OCR: emu war { type country_event placement scope:emu_War_epicenter

The victory event will first determine what method you used to win the Emu War

OCR: immediate if = limit any scope_ state filter has modifier emu War modifier any scope building building type building_livestock has_ active_production_ method pm electric_fencing level 10 any scope_building building type building barracks has active_production_method pm_mechanized_infantry level percent set_variable emu_ war_ total_victory else_ if = { limit any scope state filter has_ modifier emu war modifier any scope building 1s building_type building_livestock_ranch has active_production_method pm electric_fencing level 10 percent set_variable emu_ war_ technology_victory else_if = { limit any scope_state filter has modifier emu war modifier any scope_building building type building_ barracks has active_production_method pm_mechanized_infantry level percent set_variable emu_war_ military_victory ranch

This script will allow us to have multiple ending textts depending on the victory conditions

OCR: title emu war 2.t desc first_valid { triggered_desc { trigger { has_variable emu war_total_victory desc emu_wars first_valid { triggered_desc { trigger { has_variable emu war technology_victory desc emu_wars.d2 first_valid { triggered_desc { trigger { has_variable emu war military_victory desc emu_wars.d3 flavor emu war 2.f

Oh and turning debug mode off makes the pre-activation JE a lot more comprehensible

OCR: The Emu War Will activate if: Western Australian State Is in Australia Arable land greater than 15 Available arable land less than 5 Western Australia has researched Electrical Generation Western Australia has researched Mobile Armor Any

Now, what should happen if you succeed..

First off we should remove the negative modifiers

I think no matter how you resolved this, the Rural Folk IG will be pleased with you

If you slaughtered the emus... I suppose having the Armed Forces gain a little political influence makes sense (edited)

And if you don't massacre a whole species, the Intelligentsia will probably be pelased

Question is what should you get for TOTAL VICTORY over the emus?>

@Spencer

Farm throughput?

Does it make sense for your farms to be extra productive? They're already more productive by virtue of having the emu modifier removed

@Viligans

Yeah I quite like this

The vent is written, now more debuggingh

OCR: The Emu War: Victory Event in Western Australia Bullet-ridden emu corposes litter the ground of Western Australia. We have won a glorious victory the enemies of mankind: Eiu noises Former Emu Field Marshall A medal for every Western Australian soldier! . I think that's enough scripting for today. To finish this content, we'd have to write the failure event, polish the post-activation journal text a lot, and generally make the writing... good.

If I were to become satisfied that it's done, I'd push my branch and make a merge request. A fellow CD would then review my request and give me feedback on any bugs they find or ways to qualitatively improve things. If it gets approved, I'd document my work in jira, it would be merged into the development build ofthe game, and some poor QA would have to test it

@Granite, #MoreCanals Party

Also when it says 0 days, does that mean it's permanent or just hasn't had a day count set yet

Permanent but the text is confusing. Hopefulyl we'll clear that up

@General_WCJ

So you can't use lead content designer privileges to merge directly to the dev build?

I can but I have principles

@General_WCJ

Probably why you got the job in the first place

When I was first hired everyone was jst pushing straight to develop like maniacs

Thankfully things have changed

@Cracky

Wow, you actually have feature branching !? What blessed world is this!

We branch off for all of our work. For larger things we might make branches off of branches.

@Granite, #MoreCanals Party

Actually I have an idea for an option for the Emu War Set up a bounty for the emus, and eventually get an event saying people are farming them to make money off of them

That would be a good option for the failure event - pay a bunch of money to reduce the impact of the modifier

So yeah hopefully this has given folks some insight into how content designers work on Victoria 3, and how modders will be able to make their own content once we release

None

AAR : Japan - Pt.1 - by Daniel "neondt" Tolman

Japan! Land of the rising sun. Mighty and disconcertingly green.

OCR: 1 'n € $ €

We're want to fix the green. Green is for the Shogunate, and we are not sticking with the Shogunate

Oh and also worth noting: we're very likely to scale back Japanese ownership of Hokkaido for release, and that's not in yet

Looking at our Capacities and the top info bar.... things are pretty good. We've got lots to work with, especially financially.

OCR: +547 +1.10K +107K {+810K 19.2M 31.4% 10.2 31.9M 21

@Diddlypoop

whats that wheat thing

Standard of living. 10 is really good for the early game

@Skellius9(An-Staf-Wor-ism)

is 20M alot for japan's size?

Not really. Our economy is overall really quite underdeveloped

It's the Shogun! I don't think he'll be sticking around for too long.

OCR: Shogunate Government Shogun Ienari Tokugawa Heir Apparent Government Legitimacy: 85% Reform Government Shogunate 37.5% Happy (+6) Samurai 13.4% Happy (+6)

And I think his Shogunate and Samurai lackeys need to put in their place as well

Primary goal for this AAR, at least until we achieve it, it an early Restoration. I don't say "Meiji Restoration" because I'm hoping to achieve this goal before the reign of that particular Emperor.

So I mentioned that in a lot of ways we have a lot to work with. In another sense we don't. Most of our states are struggling with Market Access due to a lack of Infrastructure.

Daniel "neondt" Tolman

So I mentioned that in a lot of ways we have a lot to work with. In another sense we don't. Most of our states are struggling with Market Access due to a lack of Infrastructure.

This means that the more we build, the more we dig into our already limited capacity to distribute goods around the market

And the economy, or for that matter our society, is not going places unless we can start building

We're going to need trains

We're quite a long way from trains. And.... we are not good at research. Being Unrecognized as well as having very harsh laws forbidding dissent are really hurting our research rate. Plus we have Universities.

OCR: Distillation Cotton Gin 24.8 / 5.COK (+17.521 Steelworking Lathe mcr Proccss Railways Fractional Distillation

@Paul "PDJR_Alastorn" Depre

Limited economic expansion of port cities and hub centers by utilization of state based decrees + infrastructure based tech thats not trains because of lacking iron/coal/steel.

Yeah I think Decrees are going to be really important early on

I'm thinking that in order to rush trains, we should not simply research the prerequisite techs. We're going to start with Academia - build some Universities to boost our research rate and only THEN do we go trains

I have decided to spend ALL of my authority on Road Maintenance. This will have to do until we invent trains

OCR: 2 2 Hanchuria Pyeong Hoanglac' Cotgei (eusx

And in the meantime it lets us build things without incurrent Market Access penalties

@Skellius9(An-Staf-Wor-ism)

wait, how cheap is a decree

Not inexpensive. But Japan's autocratic laws give it a lot of Authority to work with

Looking at my market, things are pretty good. I expect that as we ramp up construction we'll need a lot more Iron and Wood, so those should be priority industries.

OCR: Sell Orders Orders Balance Market Price 37 26 58 € 105 (+50%) {75 (+50%) 47 84 { 41 (+39%) 79 121 {38 (+26%) 942 128K -334 {35 (+17%) 42 65 -16 { 46 (+16%) 825 LOSK 231 { 22 (+14%) 88 102 20 { 44 (+11%) Buy

People want a greater variety of food sources as well but I don't think that's a high priority

@Diddlypoop

why is so much artillery desired?

Because we're consuming it through our military buildings

First up I'm going to expand my construction sector

We should also work out where we want to go legally

It seems like moving from our economic system from Traditionalism to Agrarianism would be both popular and profitable. Agrarianism would allow us to subsidize a lot more industries if we need to, and it allows Aristocrats to contribute to the Investment Pool

@Paul "PDJR_Alastorn" Depre

@Daniel "neondt" Tolman are those sell orders of dye domestic production or dye that is being traded from other markets?

It's all domestic!

And with that I'm going to unpause

So we want to churn out a lot of wood. There's two ways we can go about that: 1. Build a whole lot of Logging Camps. This will employ more people (and we have A LOT of peasants living on Subsistence Farms). 2. Use more advanced Production Methods, building Tooling Workshops to support that. The downside here is that Tools take Wood as an input good. I can't say for sure if I'm right and I'm not going to do a lot of digging to determine this, but I think that option 1 might be best for my economy right now

Of course we're still going to need Tools because we also want to expand our Iron Mines (edited)

Now that I have a larger construction industry, the price of wood has skyrocketed. Better get chopping that wood!

OCR: 168 E 4.4K

@Avian Overlord

Will taking peasants off of farms lead to shortages of things?

The most important thing that peasants do is produce Wheat, which is currently pretty cheap

OCR: 459K 3.73K +859 {17 0 (-11%)

Eventually we might become concerned bout food production but for now we're good

We just passed Agrarianism! We did it in under a year because it had a lot of support from powerful government IG's. This means that we lose the Bureaucracy cost bonus from Traditionalism, so we are down to only a small Bureaucracy surplus.

Daniel "neondt" Tolman

We just passed Agrarianism! We did it in under a year because it had a lot of support from powerful government IG's. This means that we lose the Bureaucracy cost bonus from Traditionalism, so we are down to only a small Bureaucracy surplus.

This was pretty much all our current government is good for. I think it's time for a change

I think it's time for some new ideas, but also some older ones. The Shogun appoints the Monks and the Intelligentsia to government, disfavoring the Samurai.

OCR: Buddhist Monks 34.3% Neutral (+3) 8.4% Intelligentsia Unhappy ( 6)

The new government unfortunately doesn't have a lot of strength to pass new laws right now. So we'll just be content to have kicked the Samurai out.

Very satisfying to watch the price of wood drop as I churn out Logging Camps

OCR: 313 E7SK

Just a few more Camps and we'll switch over to Iron

We just got a Journal Entry! If we can keep the Shogunate's IG out of power for 10 years we can really start making some progress

Oh and by out of power I mean not just out of government. We need to greatly reduce their political clout

Best way to do that is to change the makeup of our economy and society so that they cease to be a relevant force

But.. a little bit of coercion would help too

@Peter (Sunsmith)

by disbanding the army?

I'd like to avoid that this time

We might have overdone the iron mine expansion. Iron is now dirt cheap, meaning the people who are mining it aren't being paid very well

Another way to think of it: let's use more iron!

I guess you can make artillery out of iron. And the army is complaining that cannons are expensive

@Skellius9(An-Staf-Wor-ism)

couldnt you just, not give them cannons, that would be so much easier

What else would I do with all this iron?

Good news, we have Academia! Time to queue up some Universties

Universities will fix our research speed issue, allowing us to get to trains faster. Employing Academics will also increase the power of the Intelligentsia, who will be vital to reforming Japanese society

Building more Arms Industries made Artillery cheaper, which lessens the burden on government expenses

@Skellius9(An-Staf-Wor-ism)

are the mines profitable enough?

Just barely

We still have a very large budget surplus.

I'm going to use part of it to increase Government Wages to maximum

This will increase the wealth of Academics and Bureaucrats and anyone else who works directly under the purview of government funded, except for the military. It'll also make the Intelligentsia happy

@Skellius9(An-Staf-Wor-ism)

this will weaken the shogunate then

Exactly!

With all these Academics running around, we're burning through a lot of paper

Should build some Paper Mills

@Skellius9(An-Staf-Wor-ism)

you had enough wood right?

Plenty!

@Skellius9(An-Staf-Wor-ism)

wait, universities are government iirc, so paper price actually determines your budget?

It does indeed. It's a direct government expense

We're researching Railways!

This would be a good time to start making some preparatory industries.

To make the trains run on time, we're going to need 3 things we currently don't have at all: Coal, Steel, and Engines

Coal can be found in the ground under Kyushu

Steel is made out of Iron primarily, and thankfully we have a lot of iron

And Engines need Steel

@Diddlypoop

kinda interesting when you think that, since japan is isolationist, the concept of railways is just developing completely domestically

To be fair I'm a nigh-omniscient being who knows what a train is

For now these new coal mines and steel mills will be VERY unprofitable. We can't use them for anything really

@Mppqlmd

coal isn't consumed by pops for their heating purposes ?

It is, but wood is preferred

Shockingly, nobody wants to work in the coal mine to extract useless black rocks

Raising wages and building universities has bumped the Intelligentsia up from barely above Marginalized to actually quite relevant!

Though the Monks hold the majority of power in the country
