AAR : Japan - Pt.2 - by Daniel "neondt" Tolman

Hello! I'll be returning to the Japan AAR in just a bit

Daniel "neondt" Tolman

Red Japan is back!

So when we left off, we kicked off the Restoration - The Komei Restoration, given that Meiji is not yet reigning - and returned Japan to a glorious red (edited)

We've got 3 journal entries to complete in order to resolve the restoration: - We need to retire the samurai and modernize the military. This one we'll complete very shortly, since we've been keeping up with our military tech and PM usage anyway. - We need to urbanize. A lot more of our states need larger urban centers - another condition is that most of our states need railways, but we have those already! - This one is by far the most difficult. We need to end our economic isolation and become a Recognized Power

Outside of Journal Entries, a major goal for this campaign is to develop a capitalistic economy where the Industrialists wield a great deal of political power

Currently nothing because they're still MArginalized

Right now there is essentially no support whatsoever for reforming our trade policy

OCR: 2.296 Mercantilism 10.7% 86.906 Enact (0% chance 180 days) 2.3% Protectionism 12.3% 85.2%6 Enact (0% chance every 180 days) 2.2% Free Trade 23.2% 74.4% Enact (0% chance every 180 days) 23.1% Isolationism 2.2% 74.6% Active Law every

My personal goal of empowering the Industrialists is to some extent a prerequisite for completing my Journal Entries, since the Industrialists will certainly support a move away from Isolation (edited)

@Cerise à bascule [TeamToothpast]

Who are these Squabbling 23%ers who don't like to import Hamburgers?

Support for Isolation (and opposition to alternatives) comes both from the Landowners (formerly the Shogunate but the Shogun is permanently removed from power) and the Peasantry (edited)

I would also quite like to shift the state religion from Buddhism to Shinto. But right now we have the State Religion law, which means that doing so would make most of our population discriminated

So I think I'll hold off on that until we liberalise our religious laws a little

It's part of a slow nation-wide process, but I've transitioned more of my Logging Camps to Private Ownership by enabling Sawmills, a more advanced Production Method. This means I made more wood, consume more tools, employ more Capitalists and Machinists, and employ less Laborers and Shopkeepers

These logging camps are doing pretty well

OCR: ~OGGING < CAMPS Building in Tohoku Information Workforce Modifiers Productivity #77 Logging Camps { 13.7 #340 in the world 15 weeks 6.88 Average Annual Employment: 40.0K 8+5/13 Cash Reserves: 200K Government Expenses: { 0.OOK Production Methods E E+ Process Weekly Balance: { +5.27K 45 E2.0K 547 {12.6K E5.29K +40 Urbanization +8 Infrastructure Throughput: +14% Wage Wages Usage

@Cerise à bascule [TeamToothpast]

What are we gonna do with all this wood?

There's always a demand for wood, you can never have enough! Especially in a closed economy where you can't just import more

@Stretchy

oh would you say japan is proto-industrial yet?

Perhaps proto-industrial

Right now I'm building some more Silk Plantations. The price has become quite high since we started employing Capitalists - wealthier pops means more demand for luxuries

@Stretchy

next step is getting coal and more factories?

We'll certainly be wanting more coal, yes!

Bye-bye Samurai

OCR: The Fall of the Samurai Event in Kanto Japan has succeeded in reforming the armed forces and putting an end to the backwards system of feudalism. The Armed Forces warrior caste seemingly no longer have a place within our modernizing society: The Shogun commanded the loyalty of the Daimyo, who in turn relied 0n their Samurai to them enforce their rule over the enserfed peasantry. This the basis of Japanese feudalism HOW relic of the past: There are those still loyal to Samurai ideals; the codes and virtues known as Bushido, and that will surely endure: But the Samurai have fallen, and we will not see their like Let them their status as officers and nobles. The era of Samurai is over. help was legacy again . keep

We're going to let the remnants of the old elite keep their officer positions though

Antagonizing the army just doesn't seem like a great idea. Downside is that further military innovation is going to be a lot more expensive

So that's 1 down, 2 to go

OCR: The Komei Restoration

I'm going to do something possibly dangerous. The Monks are really powerful, and I'm not a fan of that. And as I said before, having State Religion makes switching to Shinto a bad idea currently. So I'm going to defy the Monks and try (and possibly fail) to secularize a little

Okay so revolution progress began almost instantly

This is fine

Maybe

It's only ... the landowners. the peasantry. and the monks (edited)

@Stretchy

maybe try and remove the monks from bureaucracy first instead?

It works the other way around unfortunately

OCR: Change Secularism Production Method to Secular Administration You are not allowed to have enacted State Religion (Law) in Church and State Predicted impact on Weekly Balance with full employment after Goods Substitution: €-27.8 Increased Employment: Bureaucrats: +1.25K more in Total Decreased Employment: Clergymen: -1.25K less in Total Show per Level values

If I can pass this law, the Monks will lose A LOT of their power

This seems like a good time to raise military wages. Just in case

The army is very loyal right now at least

There's a lot of demand for meat, yet thinking long term I don't want to use up too much of my arable land. My solution: whaling

@Emperor Stafford Supporter

Are there limits on what regions can develop a Whaling industry similar to how there are limits on what places can grow certain crops?

Only a handful of states in the game are able to develop a whaling industry. Hokkaido is one of them

Oh but before I do that

I just realized we could be building a lot faster

I'm moving my Construction Camps to Iron-Frame Buildings. Which will consume a whole lot more Iron and Tools. I should make some more of those

Daniel "neondt" Tolman

I'm moving my Construction Camps to Iron-Frame Buildings. Which will consume a whole lot more Iron and Tools. I should make some more of those

Budget took a massive hit due to the newly increase cost of these goods. Which should hopefully be rectified shortly (edited)

My budget doubled when I finished a large batch of Iron mines. Government consumption of goods is a really major economic factor

@Cerise à bascule [TeamToothpast]

How do you profit off the Iron Mines?

It's not so much that I profit directly from Iron Mines (though I tax their dividends and the income of their employees). It's more that I directly but their iron, and if that's expensive then I pay a lot more

@Emperor Stafford Supporter

Fun fact: my whaling industries were flooding the Japanese market with worthless oil

@Dictator [Rogue Servitor Party]

Once I actually find a use for oil, they'll be extremely profitable. For now the oil is worthless, and I only care about meat production (edited)

@Cerise à bascule [TeamToothpast]

Can you use Whale Oil to fuel cars?

You can use whale oil for any purpose that regular oil is used for. So yes you can power a diesel engine with whales

I.. actually don't know if Japan is scripted to have a native source of oil. We might actually have to rely on whales if we don't manage to end our isolation by the time it becomes relevant

Ah nevermind, there's oil in Chubu

@Spencer

They can. Heating needs aren't a huge portion of pop expenditure though

@Stretchy

Yeah you just can't squeeze very much oil out of whales. Oil Rigs give you vastly, vastly more oil.

AAR : Japan - Pt.3 - by Daniel "neondt" Tolman

Alright let's get back to it then!

It's 1853. The Emperor has been restored to power and the Shogunate is no more

The Samurai have fallen, replaced by a modern professional army (edited)

And we are slowly industrializing

No colonization for now, but we'll certainly get around to it

@Skelly Against Trains

do we even have colonial institution even

We do not

I think what I want to do first here is identify industries ripe for privatization

These Furniture Manufacturies for example. Now under new Capitalist management

OCR: FURNITURE MANUFACTURIES Building in Chubu Information Workforce Modifiers Productivity #9 Furniture Manufac {19.3 #76 in the world 8.72 Average Annual Employment: 30.0K Cash Reserves: 150K Auto-Expand Government Expenses: { 0.OOK Production Methods f+ Process Weekly Balance: {+6.11K Wage

We also ought to make some changes to the Paper industry

I can't privatize paper because I'd need to advance to a PM that requires Sulfur, and I'm not making any of that

So I'll build a few mines

@Starwalker

Do mines mine different things based on where they are built or are there specific mines for each resource?

Specific mines for each resource

Oh and people want more tea

What are we, Brits?

We're killing so many whales that meat is finally affordable

OCR: 418 525 -177 {36 (+21%)

I'm privatizing the coal mines as well. They make A LOT less money as a result, for several reasons: - Capitalists take a higher wage than shopkeepers - More input goods needed for atmospheric engine based mining - More Machinists and Engineers vs Laborers, who also take a higher wage

And and of course: - High coal output reduces the price of coal

On the other hand: - More capitalists = more Industrialist power - Cheaper coal = other industries benefit - The pops employed are richer

What I'm saying here is that pure profitability isn't the most important thing to optimize when you're micromanaging your economy

@HYPOstasis

Does changing the PM also reduces the amount of workers in total? Or does it just increase their throughput in this case?

Sometimes it does. In this particular case it actually increased the number of workers, meaning an overall increase to SoL in the state

Looking at more advanced base mining PM's, once you switch away from Picks and Shovels, the number of workers remains consistent. But there are other PM categories that will affect workforce differently. For instance using Steam Donkets would drastically reduce the required workforce

Right now I generally want to increase the amount of people employed in buildings

Anyway I will now stop talking about how to optimize your coal mines for the purposes of developing a capitalist economy

Oh. Just like how the paper industry could be privatizing by adding sulfur, the glass industry could be privatized by adding lead. I'll build some lead mines as well

@HYPOstasis

Do you require certain PMs in order to change ownership or is just that you're doing both at the same time? I don't remember reading anything about that but it makes sense that certain PMs require different types of ownership.

You need to advance beyond the most basic production PM to use anything other than Merchant Guilds for most buildings

Well this could have gone better

OCR: PAPER MILLS Building in Chubu Information Workforce Modifiers Productivity #80 Paper Mills { 0.0 #4730 in the world E 0.92 Average Annual Employment: 54.9K 55.0K 11 Cash Reserves: 185K / 275k Auto-Expand Governmnent Expenses: { 0.OOK Production Methods E+ Process Weekly Balance: {-3.S0K 659 E13.7K (J) 197 {12.9K 1.12K { 24.2K {1.04K +220 Urbanization +22 Infrastructure Throughput: +20% Wage Vages Usage

I didn't build enough Sulfur Mines so price of sulfur is high. Increased production of Paper lowers the price. Between these factors Paper Mills are very unprofitable

On the plus side my government expenses just went down a lot (edited)

I .. think I actually just need to downsize my paper industry. I can't support the number of mills I have because they're just too damn productive

There we go. Problem solved. I removed some Paper Mills elsewhere in Japan. Both paper and sulfur are now reasonably priced (built more mines, consumed less of it), and the building is profitable once more

OCR: PAPER MILLS Building in Chubu Information Workforce Modifiers Productivity #69 Paper Mills 4.0 #3640 in the world Lll Average Annual Employment: 55.0K 11 Cash Reserves: 177K / 27SK Auto-Expand Government Expenses: { 0.OOK Production Methods Et Process Weekly Balance: {+3.07K 660 {13.4K 198 E 9SK 1.12K E27.1K (€ ) Wages E1.18K +220 Urbanization +22 Infrastructure Throughput: +20% Wage Usage

All these extra mines are making Tools quite expensive. I'll make more

@Spencer

Any reason the Devout aren't in favor of the movement?

They just tried to overthrow the government!

Ways to suppress the landowners:

Abolish the monarchy. We're not doing this

Move away from Autocracy. I don't want to institute democracy, but we could at least become an Oligarchy, which would empower Capitalists as well as Aristocrats rather than only the former

And finally, I can just continue modernizing the economy. I'll do this anyway but it's the slowest means towards political change

I think I'll start by enacting Oligarchy. The Emperor must be advised by a cabal of capitalistic oligarchs who know what's best for everyone

OCR: 27.2% Mercantilism 7.0% 65.7% Enact (27% chance every 180 days) 28.0% Protectionism 9.4% 62.4% Enact (27% chance every 180 days) 27.2% Free Trade 17.4% 55.3% Enact (27% chance every 180 days) 16.5% Isolationism 27.2% 56.2% Active Law

@Stretchy

What are pros and cons of each?

There's a lot to consider. Probably more than I can type out right now

I think we'll ease into this whole foreign trade thing. Let's go with Protectionism for now

If we end up liking the outside world we might open up more

So far, not liking these foreign ideas so much

OCR: Egalitarianism Unlocked Egalitarianism is the doctrine of the equality of mankind and the desirability of political, economic and social equality. II Modifiers +1 Minimum Expected Standard of Living from Literacy

A problem with leaving isolationism though

The outside world really doesn't have anything that I want

Everything Japan needs, it already produces

@Dictator [Rogue Servitor Party]

Export stuff you are making

But I need the stuff I'm making!

I'm gonna call it a night. Will continue Japan again another time!

None

AAR : Japan - Pt.5 - by Daniel "neondt" Tolman

Let's play some more Japan

I played through a couple of years just now and managed to pass Protectionism - this is a major change to the country because it replaces Isolationism. We are now at least somewhat open to the wider world's economy, allowing trade routes.

The Industrialists were hugely in favour of the law

As it stands, there's really nothing in particular that Japan wants to buy from the rest of the world.

But there are some goods we're overproducing, and where I'd welcome some exports

In particular, we make a lot of warships, guns, artillery, explosives, and ammunition

OCR: 212 132 +80 { 42 (-28%) 212 132 +80 {49 28%) 208 112 +89 {31 (-37%) 298 132 +158 {25 (-50%)

I'm going to start out by selling ammo to the Brits, who seem to be in need of it

Restoration complete! (note that I disabled the requirement to become Recognized but have not updated the event text yet)

OCR: Renewed Japan Event in Kanto A reformed army, an open and recognized country,= new society.[ Japan stands as an equal among the powers of the world,and will perhaps begin to pursue imperial ambitions ofher own: 'By the of heaven we sit UpOn the sacred throne 0n which our ancestors reigned from time immemorial. The civilization and institutions of are SO different from those of other countries that we cannot expect to reach the declared end at once. It is Our purpose to select from the various institutions prevailing among enlightened nations such as are best suited to our present conditions; and adapt them in reforms and improvements of our policy and customs SOo as to be upon equality with them:' The Japanese Empire shall rise. We will need powerful friends, for we shall make powerful enemies Railways are the to our future success blessing Japan gradual key

I think it's finally time to pass the Poor Laws

International trade is starting up

OCR: Goods Traded Amount Level Your Export Trade Routes -64.8 2 Other Countries' Trade Routes 0 inbound, 3 outbound) Outbound Trade Routes -32.4 -16.8 -27.4

On closer inspection, there actually is something Japan needs but can't effectively produce - sugar

Japan isn't a suitable place for sugar plantations. We produce a small amount of sugar from other sources but it's deeply inefficient. I'll just buy some from the Brits

Trade routes are developing nicely. British Sugar for Japanese Bullets

The game doesn't make any particular distinction between "overseas" and not (edited)

Even if Okinawa was a good place to plant sugar (it is not), it has hardly any arable land

Poor Laws passed!

We got rather a lot of loyalists from the increased SoL

OCR: Loyalists 5.01M 25 Jul; 1875 24 Jul; 1876

In fact I think I want to invest even further in this

I'll make a lot of Government Administrations so I can afford to expand it

By the way, new post-Restoration flag!

OCR: Information Modifiers Diplomacy 13 316 21 Timed Modifiers GDP E100M Population 58.3M Literacy 44.8% Standard of Living Impoverished (10.31) State Religion Shinto Government: Empire Primary Cultures Japanese Arable Land 29.8% 11.6% 10.9% 930

@Dictator [Rogue Servitor Party]

How much peasants do we have? And how many people are unemployed? It would be nice to see breakdown by profession Like -5% Bureaucrats representing more vacancies than available Bureaucrats or +10% Machinists - that is 10% machinists doesn't have job.

We still have 26 million peasants. I'm continually employing more and more people, but I'm not keeping up with population growth. Hence the need for Poor Laws

Our population is about the same the Great Britain's now!

Not counting tiny countries experiencing a gold rush, Sweden has the highest SoL

@Dictator [Rogue Servitor Party]

I wonder if you had auto-expand on all buildings then peasants would eventually get a job, as you only had to seed buildings here and there

I would much rather have manual control over my construction queue

I'm building constantly and I think I can prioritize construction better than automatic building construction

@Russ Kaunelainen

Given how SoL ties into popular dissent, I take it that these countries are going to have once the gold rush is over? :p

Very likely!

@Dictator [Rogue Servitor Party]

I can safely assume that you have at least one level of construction sector in each state for flat boost

That's really not how buildings work

I think it's time to move on from Agrarianism

We have a lot of capitalists and they have money

Time for them to start investing in the economy

We're moving to Interventionism

You're jumping the gun here Siam. I don't think it's co-prosperity time. You have nothing I want

OCR: Proposal for Trade Agreement Siam wishes to enter into an Trade Agreement with us. Trade Agreement A Diplomatic Pact that establishes a Trade Agreement between two Countries. Decline Accept

@Russ Kaunelainen

Remind me what a Trade Agreement does?

No tariffs, so essentially no barriers to trade. You're still in different markets so you need to make import/export routes, but they're cheap.

@Dictator [Rogue Servitor Party]

Is economic WC possible? - inviting everyone to custom union

I don't think that's very likely

Rising costs of running a growing government aren't really keeping up with my revenue. We're actually losing money now for the only time other than the civil war.

I'm hoping that getting the Capitalist investment pool up and running will subsidize enough of my construction budget that I'll be in the green again

There are very few radicals in the country. I really don't need max level police. I'll downsize them to make room for more Poor Laws

... Yes. Interventionism was the right choice

OCR: Investment Pool: {12.ZM (Change: € +56.4K)

Alright I need to call it quits for today. I'll leave you with this

OCR: Reform Underway: No Colonial Affairs to Colonial Exploitation

None

AAR : Belgium - Belgium by Daniel "neondt" Tolman

Alright let's look at Belgium

Belgium sits in stark contrast to Japan in 1836. It has a developed urban economy with many Capitalists and advance Production Methods active. It has Railways, active Trade Routes, and laws that place it distinctly outside of the realm of feudalism

OCR: FLANDERS State Overview Buildings Population Information Urban Buildings Urban Center {7.2 Government Administration 2 Food Industries 2 { 6.3 Furniture Manufacturies 2 {15.9 Textile Mills 2 { 8.3 University Arms Industries 1+1 {13.1 Glassworks E0.0 Mills {4.1 Paper

Looking at Wallonia, we have plenty of untapped natural resources and undeveloped Arable Land

OCR: Resource Coal Mines Iron Mines Lead Mines Logging Camps 5/35 4/35 {9.7 0/18 0/13 Agriculture Unused Arable Land: 37 E0.8 Wheat Farms Livestock Ranches E6.5 0/37

But there are things we just don't have. Tea, dyes, cotton, sugar, sulfur, coffee, and other kinds of resources are largely outside of our ability to produce

Thankfully, the game offers a solution to that

OCR: No Colonial Affairs to Colonial Exploitation 17 August,1836: Success: 20.2% Advance: 40.5% Debate: 39.1% Stall: 0.0%

@Roses

whats your navy status?

We don't have one!

And although we do have an army it absolutely cannot stand up against the vast legions of our neighbours: France, Prussia, and Great Britain

Speaking of our neighbors. We probably want to keep them happy

OCR: Improve Relations Neutral (-1) Improve Relations Neutral Improve Relations Neutral (0)

We also have an election going on

OCR: 1836 <CAMPAIGN Election in Belgium Date of Election 29 September; 1836 (in 147 days) Current Polls 359k 0%6 31 Mar; 836 1836 Total Voters 1.02M Politically Inactive 3.79M Parties Catholic Projected Votes: Momentum: -22% 35SK (38%) Interest Groups Liberal Projected Votes: Momentum: 5% 258K (27%) Interest Groups Christian People'$ Projected Votes: Momentum: 50% 319K (34%) Interest Groups May; Party Party Party

Currently the Liberal Party, composed of the Industrialists and Intelligentsia, sit comfortably in government

The Industrialists strongly support our colonialism law, so I'm happy to keep them around

I'm so so sure about these guys.

OCR: God's Will Event in Flanders Florent de Stockem, of the Catholic Church, has been seen preaching in favor of the Christian People'$ Party, convinced that their victory has been foreseen in God's plans. "Do you think that God would not have a plan for Our pious nation? Of course there is a plan! There must always be a plan! Ive seen it let me tell You, and I've seen it as clear as I see you all right now, just before my eyes_ And who else is to lead this adrift government other than those who can clearly read that plan?" And who are we to stand against God's will? Such a shame the nation is not ruled by God, then. But God surely wants the to win! myself;

@Jacko

All African pops are discriminated against. So while we do hire Africans in our buildings (including barracks), preference is always given to non-discriminated pops

It's very hard to convince Belgians to move to Africa though, so most of our forces in Africa are made up of African soldiers

OCR: Politically Inactive 3.24M

Super Skelly 4 Turbo HD remix

Why is the red 0 red?

OCR: 0% Cultural Turmoil Global Tupinamba Turmoil: 0% 0% Tupinamba Turmoil in Brazil: 0.02%

yeah, think we can make the UX clearer there as a bright red 0 indicates something bad

but being that low it's fine really

Mumbling Historian

Have Brazilian IGs been localised?

No. Generally unless if the localization would just be the name translated we're not changing them. If there's a specific group that would represent the same niche as that IG we tend to localize them. I've been considering making some localizations for stuff like that around Brazil during my PDT but not sure if it will make it in

Authority's main advantage it is expedites enactment time of laws.

OCR: Attitude Game Concept An indication of how another Country feels aboutyou; based on Relations_ Infamy, Strategic Desire, and factors as how 'large your military is and which Countries you have Diplomatic Pacts with: Attitude affects what sorts of actions Country is likely to take towards you and what role you play in their plans_ Such

OCR: Relations Game Concept The current stance of diplomatic Relations between two Countries. Both sides can influence this mutual score using the Improve Relations, Damage Relations, and Expel Diplomats Diplomatic Actions by spending Influence Relations impact which Diplomatic Actions and Pacts are valid interaction options for the Countries, and also impact the likelihocd they will accept diplomatic overtures or take your side in Diplomatic Play:

I view them as a bit of a venn-diagram, they overlap but are not the same.

@One Adorable Puppy

How does the amount of infamy for a unify diplo play for influenced minors in a major play differ from puppetting cost + unify play for a normal unification or straight annexation cost (+ normal unification?)

don't ask numbers questions like that it makes my head spin and all numbers are subject to change before release.

It also doesn't account that multiple separate diplo pays will have different infamy costs because of the amount of costs one needs to pay to bribe in other powers multiple times.

It should be cheaper to vassalize than outright annexation.

Unification is a bit different, lets find out and do some quick math

So it would be 30+ infamy to conquer Denmark alone

if that answers your relative cost question

Which fits, you are subjugating a people not playing to any sense of universal brotherhood

PUs exist as a special subject type

Diplomatically and economically integrated yet slightly independent

Yes there's a variation the spectrum of vassals of who does what in relations to tech, culture, diplo, economics, etc.

I think the dev diary does a decent job of describing them.

But in general PUs are the very specific by event or game start example.

The Grand Dutchy looks to be in a Personal Union

Sorry little busy trying to make sure the economy doesn't derail with all the railroads I am building

Alright, we are on to trying to discover nationalism

And making them more happy does not make them powerful, which increases the scale of the modifer

I need to increase IG clout for that

But I also need to balance a budget and start getting into military industry soon

IG effects is based on approval + clout to whether the malus/benefit is given and to what size it is

Wealth voting, this early in the game are you mad?

Its an oligarchy at best

At this point I find it more reasonable to increase the number of bureaucrats than the per capita of their power - because I can only reform laws so quickly.

Wealth voting would see increasing wages give more clout that way but not in an easy 1:1

Trying to pass weath voting this early would be a revolution and a half

since next to no one supports it domestically

I am expanding universities but remember I'm still around half a million pounds in debt and trying to industrialize

Keeping the IG happy is about the best I can do right now

government funds and attention are going into three main processes Industry for military Trains and the like for an export industry Tech for Pan Nationalism

I could put more industry behind it but I need to balance the three choices right now anyways

The Russian AI doesn't need to be competent past a point - it just needs to be willing to bleed me longer than I can sustain.

Caracus

NEF

Paul, curiosity question. If you have only one state or less, does your capital state also become your market state? Was reading a dev diary before about special states and that got me wondering. If you’re not allowed to answer, that’s fine!

In most cases the market capital and national capital are the same. Though a market capital can be moved by decree - and in the case of the USA starts in New York

Dictator [Rogue Servitor Party]

What happens if market/national capital gets conquered?

You should probably guard your capital better.

If it gets conquered, it moves. If it gets occupied - it better not be occupied for long.

Krakow's market capital is in Vienna since its in a custom's union.

If it was independent they would both be in the split state.

Dictator [Rogue Servitor Party]

What happens to my colonies, that are clusters of multiple states in that case?

If London gets occupied because you weren't paying attention, everyone suffers and the colonies have trouble getting goods to and from market though have their local supplies. And that amount of dissatisfaction, if left alone can lead to independence movements.

Because if you cannot protect the Jewel of your own empire, how can you claim to protect them?

I like playing Krakow from time to time, its a hard start.

Until we manage to get split state secessions to work right, all you do is make a QA cry.

how can you tell impatient QA has a plan

cause I am a MADMAN

Lloyien

Demand for tools grows consistently, sure, but if you plunge the value of tools too low, the end result is all of your tool manufactories going broke because their product is too cheap.

you know what you need to do to prevent this?

Increase the demand by modernizing MORE

I'm having tool shortages domestically right now.

The concept of them going under due to lack of demand is not on the radar of possibilities

all tools are child size if you consider multiple children can carry one

I mean, material choice for tools is often a function of the tool's purpose; not so much an upgrade. Though now that you've shared that: pig iron tools seems wrong; you wouldn't make much out of pig iron, it's an intermediary step in steelmaking. "Cast Iron" may make more sense

Pretty sure a QA bug for that already exists but its a low prio among the others. And yes tools don't necessary work like that but its an aggregate of simulation that having X type of tools means working towards the complexity of those types of purposes.

Dictator [Rogue Servitor Party]

Ledger for all buildings and pops in the world would be cool I guess

Hot take, I don't like ledgers.

Ledgers are a workaround to poor UI and workflow planning. There's a difference between putting the information in a meaningful way and just putting the info in a ledger accessible from the menu.

They can be useful, but they are also a crutch.

HYPOstasis

Ledgers are really nice for graphs and AAR type things, but I don't think I've ever really used them for anything else useful

They have a place, the trick is making them work well. I remember when it was easy to just look in the ledger in EUIV and tell if I was bluffing that I had troops or not

See now a ledger at the end to give summary info, that would be cool. But I wouldn't want one that's constantly accessible, we should be challenged to make it where you can find that info better in the UI and workflow and just making a ledger for it.

General feedback.

Sweden, a summary: its 1846 - we've tech rushed pan nationalism. We have the ability to unite Finland, Denmark, and Norway.

But I've also built up my ports and I am importing tons of coal from America now

I'm encouraging people to migrate north to fill production jobs in my train and rail industries.

Here's the crux of my current problem as Sweden

I only have around 100k peasants who are not employed in my industry

I am trying to get as many of them to go north to Stockholm and Norrland to work in the arms industry, but I also need troops We are going to be working with very limited resources

OCR: Child Labor Allowed Children'$ Rights) Children'$ Rights Child Labor Allowed 30% Dependents Income 41.1% 0.8"6 Ae Max Education Institution Investment 0% Farmers Mortality 5.0% Laborers Mortality Rights of Womcn +5.0% Machinists Mortality Propertied Women +5.0% Peasants Mortality x No legal restrictions are placed on where children may work Welfare Go to Dctails screcn No Social Security 1

@greenyura

what difference between propertied and guardianship?

Birthrate vs workforce ratios

@greenyura

so propertied just cuts birthrate and even dont give a workforce ratio boost ? what the upside in taking it then?

Incorrect.

Guardianship gives birthrate modifiers nothing else. Propertied gives minor workforce modifiers The further you go progressive means more morework and a birthrate decrease.

A potential war in Finland requires preparation

AAR : Guatemala - Pt.1 - by Daniel "neondt" Tolman

Guatemala - Banana Republic starts here!

It's a beautiful day in the United Provinces of Central America. The sun is bright, the birds are singing

OCR: Central , 1

The radicals are...

OCR:

Oh no

OCR: 4ushTa Active Journal Entries Central American Dissolution Central American Dissolution Central American states with high Central American states with high turmoil may secede turmoil secede Will complete if: Turmoil in Guatemala is less than 20.00% Turmoil in Honduras is less than 20.00% Turmoil in Costa Rica is less than 20.00% Turmoil in San Salvador is ess than 20.00% Turmoil in Nicaragua is less than 20.00% Will fail if: Any Central American State (Currently 5) At least one of these: State Region is Guatemala State Region is Honduras State Region is Costa Rica State Region is San Salvador State Region is Nicaragua If failed: Triggers the Event The Dissolution of Central America Central America is dissolved, you will play as the country most appropriate to your capital state: You can change your national capital through the Political ens Kazakhs may ( . ; When

So first things first. San Salvador is a boring capital. We're moving the capital to Guatemala

OCR: chiapis Change Capital State to Guatemala Guatemala into our Capital State will give the state the following benefits: +25% Universal Political Strength +25.0% Taxation Capacity Changing our Capital State will result in country-wide penalties that will decay over a period of 5 years: -10% Bureaucracy 10% Authority 10% Influence While these penalties are in effect; we will be unable to change the Capital State again: Caribb Iean 1 Spa Honduras Making Pop

This is important because, like the tooltip says, when we inevitably implode we get to continue as a new country based on the location of our capital

And we want to be Guatemala

Now that I've changed my capital, I can't change it again for quite some time, so I've made my bed and must lie in it (edited)

Why, Guatemala, I hear you ask?

Guatemala has the most Arable Land of any Central American state, and even more importantly it has access to two resources that you won't find in any of the others: cotton and iron, vital building blocks for building our economy

OCR: Resource Iron Mines Logging Fishing Wharves 0/18 713 Agriculture Unused Arable Land: 24 0.8 Maize Farms Livestock Ranches Banana Plantations Coffee Plantations 2/26 E5.9 V25 5.0 Cotton Plantations Dye Plantations Sugar Plantations Tobacco Plantati 0/24 0/24 0/24 0/24 Camps

Which isn't to say the other states don't have their own advantages. Costa Rica for instance has plenty of (untapped) coal deposits

But for the early game these basic resources will serve us better than coal, given that we're not in a larger market and have nobody in particular to sell it to without setting up a more elaborate trade network that we're not really in a position to establish

Things could certainly be looking better for us

OCR: Current Situation States in Turmoil Central American Chiapas is in Turmoil San Salvador is in Turmoil Guatemala is in Turmoil Honduras is in Turmoil Nicaragua is in Turmoil Costa Rica is in Turmoil Input Goods Shortages Small Arms Input Goods Shortage in the Central American Market Clippers Input Goods in the Central American Market Unhealthy Economy Shortage

We're going to start off by making a Construction Sector in Guatemala for obvious reasons, and then we'll want to build a port so that we'll be able to trade after the inevitable happens

Our bureaucracy ... could be healthier

OCR: 65.2 450 540 Bureaucracy Balance: -65 Effects from 68% Bureaucracy deficit (usage is higher than generation): +68.6% Tax Waste Your total generation of +95.1 Bureaucracy is due to: +100 from Base Value +5% from Ruler Trait Meticulous -9% from Recently Moved Capital State Your total usage of -160 T( Bureaucracy is due to: Incorporated States- -60 1.68M Pops in Incorporated States: 50 Trade Routes:-50

The government could also be healthier

OCR: Republic Government Legitimacy: 3900 President Francisco Morazan Radicals 420K Loyalists Intelligentsia 3.70 Neutral ( 2)

There is something I can do to improve my economy just a little bit in the short term

It's our favorite Decree once again: Violent Suppression

OCR: Issue Violent Suppression +2% Mortality per Turmoil -50% State Penalties from Turmoil Cost: 100 Authority Use the nation's national guard to control the angry mobs Violent Promote Road Emergency Social Maintenance Suppression Relief Mobility

Violent Suppression reduces state penalties from turmoil, and since one of those penalties is tax waste, we'll be able to coerce the radicals into at least paying some taxes

Emergency relief is more of a long-term radical reduction plan. I don't have a long-term

Well that doesn't look good

OCR: Auras

We've got a choice to make here. And it's best that we stick to it once we make it. We can either let the secessionists go peacefully and build stronger relations between our small nations, or we can curse their sudden yet inevitable betrayal and get claims for a future reconquest

OCR: Honduras Secedes Event in Honduras Honduras has declared its secession from Central America. This has prompted further instability and turmoil in the remaining states of our fragile union: "The President signed decree allowing the remaining states secede, but this was nothing more than formality; the dissolution of our confederation was already reality. But perhaps what was may come given time for the wounds of division to heal:" Let them have their independence They will regret this betrayal: again,

I think they're going to regret their betrayal

OCR: Honduras Central America gains Claim on Honduras Honduras Gets 250 Devastation .00% of Pops in Centra America become more Radical Honduran Relations towards Central America deteriorates by 50 50.00% of Pops in Honduras become more Loyalist

Hilariously this actually improved our bureaucracy and economy

OCR: +747 +153 +545 €+515 735.8K 23.1% 10.3 1.28M 487K

Oh, I see a reason why the economy is "better". The southern state regions are now isolated because they're unconnected to our capital - which has no port

AAR : Guatemala - Pt.3 - by Daniel "neondt" Tolman

Alright let's get back to it. Guatemala - Banana Republic continues here

So this is quite interesting. Mexico isn't actually a trade partner at all right now. But I suppose this would be an opportunity to explore what kind of trading relationships we might want to develop with our largest neighbor. Not to mention, if we accept our diplomatic relations will improve and they'll be more likely to side with us (or at least not against us) in our wars

@zeWuzard

Economics is the core loop. That is the game. Same in SP and MP

@zeWuzard

I agree and am excited for it but Watching any amount of time on a victoria 2 multiplayer game show what people in mp expect from a victoria title

I don't feel that fostering a competitive multiplayer scene or catering to that style of play is important. It's entirely at odds with what the game is trying to achieve

For competitive MP, you can play HoI or EU4. You probably shouldn't look to CK or Vicky for it

@zeWuzard

Not competitive but interactive. I don't like competitive vic2 I get crushed in micro on vic2 but when I feel like I can't even point the front line in a direction or i want a strategic area in an enemy lands captured for diplomatic or economic reasons it doesn't seem like a good sustainable warfare system

In Victoria 3, wars are lost and won on the economic, diplomatic, and technological level. That's where the challenge is, rather than during the course of a war itself.

@zeWuzard

By leaving out the multiplayer people that loved the war system in the first place?

You still have that war system! In every single other PDS game

@Mumbling Historian

V2's war system was the least important part of the game

I'm not sure I agree with that. I think it was a very important part of the game, in the sense that is was essentially mandatory to engage with it and doing so took up a great deal of player attention. I think it's more accurate to say that war was the least interesting part of V2

AAR : Guatemala - Pt.4 - by Daniel "neondt" Tolman

OCR: +46.3 +210 +265 +3.54K 6.1M 34.6% 13.0 1.76M 142K 90.4K 29 Caribbean Central Imerica

In terms of money and capacities we're doing pretty good.

A perpetual bottleneck however is population. Or rather, employable population.

OCR: Population Current: 1.76M Annual projected Pop Growth: +1.18% (+20.97K) Incorporated Population: 1.64M Unincorporated Population: 125K Gainfully Employed: 395K Peasants: 32.0K Unemployed: 0.63K Dependents: 1.34M

I'm going to immediately raise my health system to max level

OCR: Health System Level 4 Changing to Level 5 20% Mortality 50 weeks Cancel

Unfortunately that's about all I can do about this right now. There are plenty of ways that a country can achieve this - improving safety in the workplace, employing women, reducing mortality by not employing children, etc. But nobody in my country of any significance will support those measures

But it's possible for politicians who are not members of the Intelligentsia to support some moderate degree of reform in these areas. To do that, I have to bite the bullet and open my country to ideas about equality. This was going to happen soon or later due to tech spread, and it's going to mean that increasingly more dissident ideas are going to arise to challenge my rule.

OCR: Egalitarianism 0.00 7.S0K (65)

Next on the agenda - I need to incorporate Panama. I had entirely forgotten that it didn't incorporate automatically, as my previously conquered states were claims and thus instantly incorporated. Thankfully Panama is a Homeland for my primary culture (Central American), so it'll be a quick process

OCR: Incorporating 24 months

Finally, the continued existence of Cuba just across the sea is an obvious and outrageous insult to our sovereignty. We will need to enlist the services of a navy to deal with this urgent matter.

OCR: Revolution 7.0% Enact Dedicated Police Force Support: 38 Radicalism: 86

With so much radicalism, I don't really have any choice except to give in to their demands unless I want to fight a very, very unpleasant civil war

And really, Dedicated Police is not so bad at all

In fact, it's quite drastically better. Instead of giving the Landowners political strength, it reduces the number of radicals that are generated from standard of living decreases.

OCR: Dedicated Police Force (Policing) Law Not part of our Laws The Movement to Enact Dedicated Police Force is demanding the enactment of this Law +5 Max Law Enforcement Institution Investment Enables the Law Enforcement Institution Dedicated Police Force would provide Law Enforcement with: -10% Radicals from Standard of Living decreases ~0% State Penalties from Turmoil This Law is supported by 2 Interest Groups This country has a dedicated police force with standardized Go to Details screen training:

@Brad

funny how if you're a radical, this law is really against your interest

I suppose it makes sense though - if you're a radical right now, you're getting beaten up by the landowner's hired goons for arbitrary reasons. Under Dedicated Police, the people beating you up are "apolitical" and just doing their jobs enforcing the rightful law of the land.

AAR : Ethiopia - Pt.1 - by Daniel "neondt" Tolman

Empyreal Ethiopia starts here

OCR: Borana 'Ti g" & y 0 Wello FAussa Goijamn Welega 1 3 Hai 0 Fopos?

It's been around a century since Ethiopia was last unified under the Emperors. Since then, petty fiefdoms and squabbling fiefdoms have torn the realm apart. We're going to fix that.

Or at least, we're going to try

From Shewa, the Empire will rise again

OCR: Ankoher Addis Ababa

Let's review our starting situation. First off, we don't have a single urban building. We do have a few farm buildings, and a whole lot of Subsistence Farms (edited)

OCR: Millet Farms {6.3 - € 6.4 Livestock Ranches {5.9 Coffee Plantations {4.3 Tobacco Plantations {7.0 Logging Camps { 5.6 Subsistence Farms 83

But what we mainly have is this

OCR: Barracks 26

The diplomatic situation is that we hate our neighbors and they hate us

Being landlocked, we can't do a lot of trade, and we border nobody who has anything we want anyway

I'm immediately noticing that our capital state is almost at its taxation capacity limit, which means our first move should be to build a Government Administration.

Standard of living is... okay, by Ethiopian standards. Quite bad by the standards of people who enjoy eating food.

OCR: Standard of Living in Shewa Average Current: Struggling (9.3) Average Minimum Expected: Struggling (6.3) Lower Strata: Struggling (8.7) 5.9 Minimum Expected) Middle Strata: Middling (19.1) - 14.3 Minimum Expected) Upper Strata: Secure (22.0) 12.0 Minimum Expected) Paused Average Standard 6 Jan; 1836 20 Jan; 1836 3 2 al H e 3 0 2 6 of Living Tigra y [ Welle Aussa Goijam Welega 1 1 Nuer Kuti 3 Ha [ 1 0 Dar oposa vande Borana

Although the price of grain is actually low

OCR: 222 227 +2 {19 (~0%)

OCR: 222 227 +2 {19 (~0%)

The basic needs that aren't being met are mainly Clothes, Furniture, and Services

Something appears to be happening

Tewodros will lead us to glory. Enthrone him! We will show him how we deal with outlaws. against

I don't typically endorse save scumming, but I have a feeling that this is not the intended result of violating the sovereignty of Sidamo. Let's ... pretend this didn't happen

OCR: 68 63 Ethicnia HQ 85 -75 Achol; { [ Wello Auss Tuer Harar om Boruna 1 1 Sugadla

Oh. I investigated the issue and the ai weights for other countries joining when you violate sovereignty are not done

This explains why it went so badly in the Central America game as well

As a... workaround, we're just going to pretend that this is what happened: Sidamo foolishly refused to have its sovereignty violated, but nobody cared because they're small and irrelevant. They were quietly annexed into Shewa (edited)

All is right in the world

AAR : Ethiopia - Pt.2 - by Daniel "neondt" Tolman

Ethiopia AAR continues here

Ethiopia is united. At least, in a loose political sense. The actual extent of government control is... not incredibly high. And 1 million of our citizens are Radicals, out of 7 million. Not unmanageable, but a threat we need to be aware of. (edited)

OCR: 4 7 1 Kathiri J La hej Warsangali Isaa ( Ethiopia Nuer 2 TojWwp 7 holi Bugana

Total population

One of our three main states is not even incorporated, as we cannot afford to do so

OCR: Unincorporated State Infrastructure Incorporate 67.6 Incorporate State Cost: 67.6 Bureaucracy XThe cost (67.6 Bureaucracy) of Incorporating Gonder would lead to a deficit '~91.0) Slave State -67.4% Collection 0 Tax

And even if the state were to be incorporated, our ability to tax it would be minimal

OCR: Taxation Capacity { 288/93 -67.4% Tax Collection

We could improve our Taxation Capacity by researching this tech, which would also allow us to use better PM's in our Government Administrations. But we are very behind. It would take us 11 years to get this.

OCR: Central Archives Technology Cost: 30.0K Innovation (11 years to research) Ccntral Archivcs Modifiers +25.0 Taxation Capacity Unlocks Unlocks Standardized Filing System for Government Administration (Production Method) Unlocks Secret Police 'Law) in Internal Security Leads to Identification Documents (Technology) Requires all of the following: Centralization A modern state requires good record-keeping; and good record-keeping requires thorough paperwork If you wish to learn more, please fill form ML- 4.11866 in triplicate and expect a reponse in 2-5 working days: Pan-nationalisn Start Researching

@Mppqlmd

learning to read is an option ?

Here's the problem with learning to read: education institutions cost bureaucracy

We can't even incorporate our states, let alone fund national education

In terms of natural resources, we have a pretty good selection of agricultural goods we can produce. We have an exceptionally poor selection of every other kind of natural resource. There is no iron or coal anywhere in the country.

OCR: Resource Logging Camps 0/20 Agriculture Unused Arable Land: 122 {0.7 Livestock Ranches Millet Farms Tea Plantations Cotton Plantations 7/136 6.3 2/131 2.6 1/130 5.7 Tobacco Plantations Coffee Plantations Dye Plantations ~Sugar Plantations 1/130 { 10.1 0/122 0122 0/129 3.9

Bug. The war ended but the occupation graphics didn't disappear

Invading Somalia could be an option. We're not likely to face a lot of resistance. But I'm concerned that bringing in a huge discriminated Muslim population will be very destabilizing.

Things aren't all bad though. In terms of some basic pop needs, prices are rather good. Grain is cheap because almost everyone in the country is a subsistence farmer.

OCR: -23.4 +1.08K +537 { Authority Balance: +1082 Effects from 100% or more excess Authority (generation is higher than usage): -25.0% Enactment Time Your total generation of +1.08K Authority is due to: +100 from Base Value +250 from Autocracy +200 from National Supremacy +200 from State Religion +50 from Right of Assembly +102 from Popularity of Emperor Tewodros Solomon +20% from Oriental Orthodox Church Divine Right

Oh, and we are also very poor. The meager taxes we collect from the few peasants within the government's reach only barely cover our military expenses

@Sai

Reduce military size?

No

I think we can use one of the only good things about our nation to fix one of the most crippling obstacles to advancement - the price of grain is low, so a tax on it will not cause mass starvation and will also give us enough money to start building something.

OCR: Consumption Tax We are not collecting Consumption Taxes on Grain Collecting a Consumption Tax on Grain will cost us 150 and generate approximately E4.62K in revenue Left-Click to Add Consumption Tax

With a decent income, I'm going to start building something. It's going to be a Paper Mill. We're going to need a lot of Government Administrations, and I need them to be working as efficiently as possible. This means I need to use better than the most basic PM, which means I need paper.

We also just unlocked Law Enforcement, which means we can finally pass a law that the government wants to enact

OCR: Enacting Law Censorship 0.0% (10 October, 1841) 80.0% 9.5% Success: 76.4% Advance: 23.5% Debate: 0.0% Stall: 0.0% Currently enacted (next checkpoint in 135 days) +100 Authority -15% Technology Spread -40% Suppression impact on Interest Group Attraction +40% Promotion impact On Interest Group Attraction This Law is supported by 4 Interest Groups There is active censorship of the press and no guaranteed right of assembly: being

It is, and if you look at our Government screen you can see why

Taxation capacity is per-state. Small countries don't inherently have a better ability to exercize tax capacity - my Ethiopia for instance only has 3 states but because they each have huge populations they need a lot of government administrations to be taxed effectively (edited)

AAR : Ethiopia - Pt.3 - by Daniel "neondt" Tolman

Ethiopia AAR resumes here! Welcome to an alternative timeline of Ethiopian Reunification

OCR: 1 ~ ~ Kathiri J Igli Warszu) Isaa' Ethiopia Nuer 1 2 Fopox 1 1 holi Bugana

One difference in this timeline is that the bug where occupied countries aren't visually un-occupied after a war is fixed!

Which means you can see my pretty vassals more clearly

Another difference in this timeline is that the Emperor died of his wounds during the unification wars, replaced by his son Haile Melekot Solomon

OCR: dIAILE MELEROT <SOLOMON Emperor of Ethiopia Promote 27 Role Ruler; Politician, and Gene Interest Group Landowners Ideology Traditionalist Culture Amhara Popularity Disliked 40) Age 35 Retire Arrogant Political Operator Psychological ffliction Traditionalist Experienced Diplomat Scarred Commander Commanding 27 Battalions

Like his father, he's also a military commander. But a much less competent one. He also does not enjoy his father's support among the people

Like before, the major issue we face is being unable to effectively rule within our borders

OCR: Taxation Capacity { Using 303 of 127 -57.8% Tax Collection

And due to changes to many technologies, we no longer have the ability to fund our institutions to the same level as we could before

OCR: Education Level 2 +20% Education Access +40.0% Conversion +20% Oriental Orthodox Church (Devout) Political Strength Health System Level +10% Oriental Orthodox Church (Devout) Political' Strength 9 -5% Mortality

The economy remains highly agricultural. Most of our citizens are engaged in farming, either subsistence or organized.

OCR: Millet Farms {6.2 - € 8.2 26 Livestock Ranches E4.4-€5.8 Coffee Plantations {7.9 -{9. Cotton Plantations { 0.0 { 8.3 Dye Plantations {2.2 Tea Plantations {5.-{5.6 Tobacco Plantations {12.3 - €15.1

We're going to try to enact Agrarianism. This is going to be a bit of a hard sell because the Rural Folk now share the government with the Landowners, who hate this law. But I can't remove them from government because that's the only way we have any legitimacy at all (edited)

@Frazza

Why do the landowners hate agrarianism?

They actually approve of Agrarianism, in a vacuum. But they hate changing from Traditionalism, which they like much better

OCR: Stance on Economic System Strongly Oppose Command Economy Oppose Laissez-Faire Neutral towards Interventionism Endorse Agrarianism Strongly Endorse Traditionalism

This modifier is crazy good for my country right now. Essentially every industry in my country just got a major boost

OCR: Rural Folk Honest Work activated Apr 6 This is due to their Approval of Happy (+6_ Effects +10.0% Logging Industry Throughput +10.0% Agriculture Throughput +10.0% Ranches Throughput

@NEF

France, I'm trying to make friends here. Why do you reject my friendship?

OCR: France damaging Relations Apr 23 France have started to damage our mnutual Relations; which are currently Neutral ( 12). Their Attitude towards us is Domineering;

So there was a downside to trying to pass this law. Just as I gained a really nice throughput modifier for appeasing the Rural Folk, I lost a major source of tax income by irritating the Landowners

OCR: Noble Privileges (Inactive) I6 Trait -20.0% Agriculture Tax Income -20.0% Ranching Tax Income ~20.0% Plantation Tax Income Since this Interest Group is Powerful, their Interest Group Traits have a +100% stronger effect. Approval of Landowners is Unhappy ( 5) or worse Landowners is NOT Marginalized Whatever happened to the idea that the nobility should be left to perform its duties without being hounded by tax collectors? It is time to bring those back days

We're going to have to raise taxes to balance the budget

OCR: LUDULI High Taxes Taxation Law: Land-Based Taxation Effects: +0.85 € Land Tax +8.50 Income Tax Rate +42.5% Consumption Tax Rate 5 Legitimacy +25% Radicals from Standard of Living decreases Predicted Revenue: E44.5K Change in revenue from current tax level: € +8.59K

AAR : Ethiopia - Pt.4 - by Daniel "neondt" Tolman

Ethiopia AAR continues here

OCR: 1 Nyamwezi Sang ` J Kath Ethiopia Nuer : 3 choli Bugare 1 Gogo 2

So as you can see things are getting a little... bordergorey

And there's a reason why I'm pushing this particular piece of bordergore. By completing my Rift Valley colony, I'll achieve 2 things: 1. Britain will be blocked off from further colonization into Tanganyika and beyond, allowing me to eventually claim that territory myself 2. Unlike Kenya, Rift Valley has large deposits of coal that I can use to industrialize my country

@One Proud Saarlandian
